0.title: My goal is to finish the year as number one in tennis rankings: Alcaraz
0.article_body: World number one in men's tennis rankings, Carlos Alcaraz, said that one of his "goals" is to finish the year as the top-ranked player. "Now that I've got there (number one spot), my goal is to stay as many days, weeks and months as possible. We're going to work for that," the 19-year-old Spaniard said.

1.title: Odisha government seeks details of fake medicine supplies from Bihar
1.article_body: Following the seizure of fake blood pressure control medicines that arrived from Bihar, the Odisha government has sought details of the supplies from Bihar's Health Secretary. Earlier this month, two medicine distributors in Cuttack were arrested after huge quantities of fake medicines were seized during raids. A team from the Cuttack Police has gone to Gaya to trace the manufacturers.

2.title: Sensex loses 1,020 points, Nifty closes below 17,400 points
2.article_body: Benchmark indices closed in the red on Friday amid selling across the sectors with Sensex falling 1,020.80 points to end at 58,098.92. The Nifty fell 302.45 points to 17,327.35. Power Grid Corporation, Apollo Hospitals, Hindalco Industries, Adani Ports & SEZ and SBI were among top Nifty losers, while stocks of Divi's Laboratories, Sun Pharma, Tata Steel, Cipla and ITC gained.

3.title: Panel including PM Modi, Pope must be set up to broker Russia-Ukraine peace: Mexico
3.article_body: Mexico has proposed a council that would include PM Narendra Modi, Pope Francis and UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres, to mediate between Russia and Ukraine. The proposal was announced by Mexico's Foreign Minister Marcelo Ebrard on behalf of Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, during a UN Security Council debate. The proposal was sent to the Indian delegation, Ebrard said.

4.title: Pic showing 'clearest view' of Neptune's rings in decades released by NASA
4.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured the clearest view of Neptune's rings in more than 30 years, the space agency said. "It has been three decades since we last saw these faint, dusty rings, and this is the first time we've seen them in the infrared," said Heidi Hammel, a Neptune system expert and interdisciplinary scientist for Webb.

5.title: We're in different spaces, he's dad & I'm separated: Kirti on co-star Angad
5.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari, speaking about reuniting with 'Pink' co-star Angad Bedi for the short film 'The List', said, "It is funny, we are in different spaces." "During Pink, I was engaged and was going to get married in a three-months' time," Kirti said, adding, "Now all the years later, he's a father of two and I'm separated and single again."

6.title: Not selling equipment to Russia, only software support: Ericsson
6.article_body: Ericsson on Friday said it is only providing technical and software support to Russian clients and has not sold any telecommunications equipment to mobile operators in Russia since the start of the Ukraine war in February. This development comes amid the Swedish media reporting the company had continued its exports to Russia. Ericsson's shares fell 4% in Friday's morning trade.

7.title: Next Congress president will be Gandhis' proxy: BJP's Poonawalla
7.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Friday questioned Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot's remark that Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Ajay Maken will decide further proceedings if he becomes the party president, alleging that this proved that the next president of Congress will be a "proxy of the Gandhis". "Farzi chunav kyu phir (Why the fake polls)?" he said.

8.title: BJP-led Himachal government misleading PM Modi: Congress
8.article_body: The Congress accused the Himachal Pradesh government of misleading PM Modi and claimed that the Agniveer scheme has increased unemployment. "The PM must reprimand the state government for having around 5,20,000 unemployed youth, 66,500 unfilled government positions and around ₹70,000 crore of debt...the state government is misleading Modi," said Congress leader Rajeev Shukla.

9.title: Baby crushed to death as bike tries to overtake tractor in Pune; video surfaces
9.article_body: A six-month-old baby was reportedly crushed to death by a speeding tractor on the Pune-Nashik highway on Friday. The CCTV footage of the accident surfaced on social media, where the bike carrying the baby can be seen falling on the road while trying to overtake the tractor. Following this, the baby came under the tractor and died on the spot.

10.title: Jacqueline's stylist admits receiving ₹3cr from Sukesh to buy clothes for actress: Report
10.article_body: Leepakshi Ellawadi, who has styled Jacqueline Fernandez in the past, has reportedly told police that she received ₹3 crore from conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. "He contacted Ellawadi...to know about the brands and types of clothing preferred by Fernandez. He took suggestions from her and also handed over ₹3 crore to her to buy her favourite clothes," an official reportedly said.

11.title: Paytm at 2-week high after Goldman Sachs adds stock to 'conviction list'
11.article_body: Paytm shares gained over 3% during the session on Friday, the most in two weeks after Goldman Sachs added stock to the 'conviction list'. Goldman Sachs reiterated its 'buy' rating on the stock with a target price of ₹1,100. It said Paytm has one of the most compelling growth stories at an attractive price within its overall internet sector coverage.

12.title: AIMIM office attacked by unidentified persons in Thane
12.article_body: A group of around a dozen unidentified persons allegedly attacked the Asaduddin Owaisi-led AIMIM's office at Mumbra in Thane, Maharashtra. The incident occurred around 10 pm on Thursday and a video of it has also surfaced on social media, police said. The motive behind the attack is yet to be known and a probe is being carried out, police added.

13.title: Women's IPL likely to be held in February 2023: BCCI President Ganguly
13.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said the women's Indian Premier League will likely take place in February next year. "The BCCI is currently working on the much-awaited women's IPL," he added. Six teams are expected to feature in inaugural edition of the tournament. Besides the Women's IPL, the BCCI is also starting a girls' Under-15 one-day tournament.

14.title: 2 Christian school teachers attempt to convert woman in UP; held
14.article_body: Two teachers of a Christian missionary school were detained in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal for allegedly attempting to convert a woman, police said on Friday. The accused are sisters and an FIR was filed against them, police added. The woman claimed in her complaint that the accused entered her home and damaged statues of Hindu gods before attempting to convert her.

15.title: SC stays proceedings against BS Yediyurappa in alleged corruption case
15.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday stayed proceedings against former Karnataka CM and senior BJP leader BS Yediyurappa in an alleged corruption case. The court issued notice to a private complainant on a plea challenging the September 7 Karnataka High Court order. Yediyurappa has been accused by a social activist of taking bribes for awarding Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) contracts.

16.title: We will confront enemies: Iranian army amid protests over woman's death
16.article_body: The Iranian army has said it'll "confront the enemies" to ensure security amid the ongoing demonstrations over the death of a 22-year-old woman in police custody. "These desperate actions are part of the evil strategy of the enemy to weaken the Islamic regime," it added. Mahsa Amini died last week after being arrested by the morality police over 'improper hijab'.

17.title: Nadda says AIIMS Madurai 95% complete, Cong MP refutes with video
17.article_body: Congress MP Manickam Tagore refuted BJP chief JP Nadda's claim that the work for AIIMS Madurai is 95% completed. Tagore said he visited the site and found nothing. "Searched for one hour [at] the Thoppur site and found nothing. Someone had stolen the building," he tweeted. He also shared a video showing vacant land.

18.title: Bengaluru Police arrest 14 men for plotting to create communal disturbances
18.article_body: After the National Investigation Agency conducted raids at PFI-linked locations across India, the Bengaluru Police arrested 14 men for allegedly "plotting" to create communal disturbances. The accused were booked under the Indian Penal Code, including Sections 121 and 153A. Notably, some of the arrested accused are history-sheeters with cases of rioting against them, police said.

19.title: PCMC issues warning to societies denying entry to tax officials
19.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Friday warned 600 residential societies that they would face legal action if PCMC's property tax officials are denied entry into their premises. Reportedly, half of the property owners from these societies have defaulted on property tax payments. Tax officials are being prevented from serving notice to defaulters, a senior PCMC official said.

20.title: People should liberate Tamil Nadu from DMK's dynasty: JP Nadda
20.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Thursday said DMK has no regional aspirations and is keen on continuing dynasty politics. "Stalin and his party cannot talk about development because the letters in...DMK [stand] for Dynasty, Money swindling and Katta panchayat (kangaroo court)," Nadda alleged. He urged people to get rid of the party and ensure that lotus blooms in Tamil Nadu.

21.title: 2 held for cheating Mumbai man of ₹19.5 lakh in the name of royalty in Rajasthan
21.article_body: Mumbai Police on Tuesday arrested two men, who would pretend to be associated with royal families in Rajasthan and offer to provide loans to people. An FIR was registered after a complainant stated he had lost ₹19.5 lakh. The accused would take money on the pretext of loan processing fee and give a cheque that would be rejected, police said.

22.title: 35-yr-old Virar man accidentally kills self while fighting with wife over ₹500
22.article_body: A 35-year-old resident of Virar, Bhagwan Ramji Sharma, accidentally hanged himself while trying to scare his wife on Monday night, police said. Sharma resided in Virar West with his 26-year-old wife, Chandnidevi. "He...threatened to die of suicide if his wife didn't return ₹500. Though he was acting, he used a cloth, which got caught in the ceiling fan," police said.

23.title: I've never had the level of fame as Kim Kardashian: Charlize Theron
23.article_body: Actress Charlize Theron has stated that she has never been on the same level of fame as reality television personality Kim Kardashian. She added further said, "Back in the day, it used to be like, you want to have some of this fame so you can go make the sh*t that you really want to make."

24.title: Odisha additional tahasildar possessing 5 houses, 21 plots arrested
24.article_body: Odisha Vigilance Directorate arrested an additional tahasildar in Sundargarh for allegedly possessing disproportionate assets, officials said. The assets include a triple-storey building worth around ₹1 crore, a double-storey building worth ₹46 lakh, three residential houses and 21 plots, officials added. The tahasildar was found in possession of assets 253% higher than known sources of income.

25.title: Punjab govt faces fine of over ₹2,000 cr for failure to treat solid, liquid waste
25.article_body: National Green Tribunal has imposed a penalty of ₹2,180 crore on the Punjab government for failure to treat solid and liquid waste. Punjab government has already deposited ₹100 crore for its failure to prevent discharge of untreated sewage and solid waste. A bench led by NGT Chairperson Justice AK Goel has ordered to pay remaining amount within two months.

26.title: Vijay to cameo in Atlee's 'Jawan' starring Shah Rukh Khan: Reports
26.article_body: Actor Vijay will be making a cameo appearance in director Atlee's upcoming film 'Jawan' which features Shah Rukh Khan, as per reports. This comes after Atlee posted a picture with the two actors from his birthday celebration on social media, writing, "What more can I ask on my bday, the best bday ever [with] my pillars."

27.title: PM asked 'jaage ho?': Jaishankar on midnight call amid consulate attack in Afghanistan
27.article_body: External Affairs Minister (MEA) S Jaishankar recalled an incident wherein PM Narendra Modi made a 'surprise call' to him past midnight when an Indian consulate in Afghanistan's Mazar-e-Sharif was attacked. Jaishankar, the-then Foreign Secretary, said, "[PM's] first question was 'Jaage ho? (Are you awake?)'." PM told Jaishankar to call him directly when the attack was over, the minister recalled.

28.title: Karthik, Pant can feature together in playing XI: Adam Gilchrist
28.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist said that India can include both of their wicketkeeper-batters, Dinesh Karthik and Rishabh Pant, in the playing XI of the games at the upcoming T20 World Cup. "I think they (Pant-Karthik) can. What they bring to a team...the versatility of Karthik, he can play at the top of the order," Gilchrist said.

29.title: UP man climbs electricity tower as wife refuses to return from parents' home
29.article_body: A man in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri reportedly climbed an electricity tower after his wife refused to return from her parents' home. Despite the efforts of the electricity department, police, and others, he refused to come down and demanded his wife's return. His wife also reached the spot to convince him, and he got down after six hours.

30.title: Petrol bomb hurled at RSS office in Kannur amid protests by PFI
30.article_body: A petrol bomb was hurled at an RSS office in Kerala's Kannur on Friday. A group of two persons riding a scooter threw the bomb and broke window panes. This comes amid protests by PFI members against their leaders' arrest during raids by central agencies. According to police, incidents of stone-pelting were reported at multiple places across the state.

31.title: MP man killed teen who sexually harassed him, killed self: Police
31.article_body: The body of a 15-year-old boy was recovered from a factory site in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Thursday, a day after a 20-year-old man allegedly died by suicide and left a suicide note accusing the boy of sexually harassing and blackmailing him, officers said. "Our prima facie investigation suggests that [the man] took...boy to...factory site and killed him," SP said.

32.title: 'RRR' director Rajamouli signs contract with American talent agency CAA
32.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli recently signed a contract with American entertainment and sports agency Creative Artists Agency (CAA), reported Deadline. Rajamouli signed with CAA after the success of Jr NTR and Ram Charan-starrer 'RRR', which has earned over ₹1000 crore worldwide. Rajamouli is currently working on a film starring Mahesh Babu.

33.title: Would love to collaborate with Shehnaaz, she has a very Lahori face: Zafar
33.article_body: Pakistani singer-actor Ali Zafar said in an interview that he'd love to collaborate with Shehnaaz Gill on one of his songs if she's interested. He recalled watching a video clip of the former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and said he was intrigued by her name, adding it sounded very Pakistani to him. "I thought she also had...very Lahori face," said Zafar.

34.title: Falguni shares posts criticising Neha recreating 'Maine Payal...'
34.article_body: Singer Falguni Pathak has shared social media posts and comments criticising Neha Kakkar for her remix of the former's 1999 song 'Maine Payal Hai Chhankai' on Instagram Stories. Falguni is yet to issue an official statement. One of the comments she shared read, "Please someone ban these autotune singers and their remakes," while another read, "Sorry to our childhood memories."

35.title: Pant with his dare & courage is must in Indian starting line-up: Gilchrist
35.article_body: Former Australian cricketer Adam Gilchrist said that wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is a must in the "Indian starting line-up" for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "The dare of Pant and the courage in him, the way in which he takes on bowling attacks...I think Pant has definitely got to be in there (line-up)," Gilchrist, who played 96 Tests, said.

36.title: India's key players returning to form, team should win T20 WC: Kaif
36.article_body: Ahead of upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said the expectations are high from Team India. "With key players returning to form, India should win the finals of the World Cup," he added. The tournament will begin on October 16. India failed to qualify for the knockout stage of T20 World Cup 2021.

37.title: BJP MP Janardan Mishra cleans toilet with bare hands at Rewa school
37.article_body: BJP MP Janardan Mishra recently cleaned a toilet at a girls' school in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. A video shared by the Rewa MP on social media showed him rubbing the toilet with his bare hands, without using any equipment. Mishra said that Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha cleaned toilets at the school in Khatkhari village under BJP's Seva Pakhwada programme.

38.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan accuse each other of breaking ceasefire agreement
38.article_body: Armenia and Azerbaijan on Friday accused each other of opening fire overnight, breaking last week's ceasefire agreement that ended the worst fighting between the two former Soviet countries since 2020. Around 200 soldiers were killed in the clashes between the two sides last week. The fighting is linked to decades-old hostilities over control of the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region.

39.title: Fans fall while trying to take selfies with Ranbir Kapoor; video shows actor helping them
39.article_body: Multiple fans gathered to see Ranbir Kapoor in Maharashtra tripped and fell down while trying to take selfies with the actor. A video of the incident which is being widely shared on social media shows the actor helping them. On National Cinema Day, Ranbir and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji visited Thane's Viviana Mall to promote their film 'Brahmastra'.

40.title: Mumbai woman arrested for selling drugs to school kids
40.article_body: A woman was arrested for allegedly selling drugs to schoolchildren. The accused, Bilkis Khan, is a resident of Borivali West, an official of the MHB Colony Police Station said. The incident came to light when a Shiv Sena worker spotted four minors in school uniform allegedly smoking cannabis. Bilkis has been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

41.title: Urban naxals stalled work of Sardar Sarovar Dam for years: PM Modi
41.article_body: PM Modi alleged that urban naxals and anti-development elements had stalled the construction of Sardar Sarovar Dam in Gujarat for many years by running a campaign against the project. "A huge amount of money was wasted because of this delay. Now, when the dam is complete, you can very well judge how dubious their claims were," PM Modi said.

42.title: Actor Brad Pitt's new skincare brand lists 30ml facial serum for ₹31,000; criticised
42.article_body: Actor Brad Pitt is being criticised over the cost of his newly launched genderless skincare line, Le Domaine. As per its website, 30ml facial serum costs $385 (₹31,000) and a moisturising cream costs $320 (₹26,000). "'Genderless' seems to mean 'over 10 times the price of similar products'," a user tweeted. "$800 for...three products! All greed and no SPF," wrote another.

43.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Ayan Mukerji visit Thane theatre on National Cinema Day
43.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor and filmmaker Ayan Mukerji visited a theatre in Thane's Viviana Mall on Friday to mark National Cinema Day. They could be seen greeting fans and posing for the media at a houseful show of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva'. The film announced a ticket price of ₹75 for September 23 across theatres to celebrate National Cinema Day.

44.title: We face criticism even if we play well: Babar after historic run chase
44.article_body: Following his team's triumph in the second T20I against England, where they pulled off the highest successful chase in T20 history without losing a wicket, Babar Azam said, "We face criticism even if we play well." "The total we chased today, we've done that before," added Babar. Pakistan chased down a target of 200 with Babar scoring an unbeaten 110.

45.title: Bihar public will wipe out Lalu-Nitish duo in 2024: Amit Shah
45.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and claimed that the Lalu and Nitish duo would be wiped out in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "In 2014, you (Bihar CM) only had 2 LS seats, 'naa ghar ke rahe the, naa ghat ke'...Can Nitish become PM by changing political alliances? He has betrayed many," said Shah.

46.title: Hyd metro services extended till 12:30 am on India-Aus match day
46.article_body: The Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited has announced that rail services on all three lines will be extended till 12:30 am on Sunday on the occasion of the India-Australia T20I match. The match will take place at Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium, Uppal. Notably, Gymkhana Ground witnessed chaos on Thursday and Friday as fans rushed to get tickets for the match.

47.title: ED summons 3 Cong leaders from Andhra, T'gana in National Herald case
47.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned three Congress leaders from Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in connection with the National Herald case. Reportedly, the Congress leaders have been asked to appear before the ED next week. The agency had earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi in connection with the case.

48.title: New telecom bill may be in place in 6-10 months: Ashwini Vaishnaw
48.article_body: The new telecom bill is expected to be in place in six to 10 months, Communications Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. The Department of Telecommunications released the draft bill on Wednesday, inviting public comments till October 20. The bill seeks to replace the Indian Telegraph Act, 1885, the Indian Wireless Telegraphy Act, 1933 and the Telegraph Wires (Unlawful Possession) Act, 1950.

49.title: SEBI may enhance disclosure norms for new-age firms' IPO: Report
49.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is planning to enhance its disclosure norms for initial public offerings (IPOs) of new-age companies, Business Standard reported. The market regulator may also bring transactions in mutual fund units under the purview of insider trading regulations. It may reportedly also ask firms to provide key performance indicators in their offer documents.

50.title: Man shot dead, face crushed with stone in Jharkhand; police begin probe
50.article_body: A man was allegedly shot dead and his face crushed with stone in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, police said. Sukhram Munda's body was found on Thursday in Naxal-affected Lanji village under Toklo police station. According to police, Munda was missing since Monday when he had gone to a weekly market. His face was crushed to conceal his identity, police added.

51.title: Nearly 200 pilot whales die after being stranded on Australia beach
51.article_body: Nearly 200 pilot whales have died after being stranded on a beach on the west coast of Tasmania, Australia. The whales were discovered in Macquarie Harbour on Wednesday. Wildlife experts said they've managed to refloat 32 of the 35 whales that survived. The creatures were found two years after Australia's largest-ever whale mass stranding was discovered in the same harbour.

52.title: Hyderabad's Nagole flyover likely to open for public on October 15
52.article_body: The majority of the construction of the Nagole flyover in Hyderabad has been finished, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) officials said. The flyover is likely to be opened to the public on October 15. The 900-metre-long and 24-metre-broad flyover will connect LB Nagar and Uppal and help commuters skip the current signal-heavy stretch between both areas.

53.title: Prepare for blackouts if Russia switches off power grid: Estonia to citizens
53.article_body: Estonian PM Kaja Kallas has told citizens that power blackouts are possible if Russia decides to disconnect Baltic states from the joint power grid. Kallas said any disruptions would be "temporary" and "Estonia has been preparing for emergency desynchronisation from the Russian electricity system for years". She also assured her people that Russia's mobilisation posed no direct threat to Estonia.

54.title: Indian Railways introduces e-catering services at 310 stations
54.article_body: The Indian Railways has introduced e-catering services at 310 stations which are managed by Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation. Passengers can pre-order meals of their choice at the time of booking of e-ticket or while travelling on the train using app/call centre/website/calling 1323. IRCTC stock was trading marginally higher at 702.80 on the BSE at 3:30 pm on Thursday.

55.title: Man's newspaper ad about losing his death certificate goes viral
55.article_body: A man's newspaper advertisement about losing his death certificate has gone viral on social media. Indian Police Service (IPS) officer Rupin Sharma shared a photo of the advertisement and wrote, "It happens only in India." Reacting to the post, Twitter user wrote, "This is Ad-bhoot," and "Time travel is real."

56.title: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points as indices turn negative for the year
56.article_body: The Sensex crashed over 1,000 points on Friday to 57,981, whereas Nifty declined by 302 points to 17,327 amid weak global cues. With Friday's decline, Sensex and Nifty wiped out most of their gains on a year-to-date basis, turning negative for the year. The markets were dragged by broad-based losses across sectors on Friday, led by banking, power, auto stocks.

57.title: 'Hate crimes against Indians rising in Canada,' says MEA; issues advisory for students
57.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has issued an advisory for students & other Indians travelling to Canada in view of "a sharp increase in incidents of hate crimes, sectarian violence & anti-India activities in Canada". Indians travelling to Canada have been asked to "exercise due caution and remain vigilant". India has taken up the issue with Canada, MEA said.

58.title: Tesla countersues California agency in workplace racism dispute
58.article_body: Tesla has filed a countersuit against California Civil Rights Department (CRD) after the agency accused the company of tolerating racial discrimination against Black workers at its Fremont factory. The countersuit alleged that CRD violated state law by not seeking public comment before filing a lawsuit in February. It also said that Tesla was not given adequate notice of claims.

59.title: Akhilesh Yadav, SP leaders stage walkout from UP Assembly
59.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) head Akhilesh Yadav and other party leaders staged a walkout from Uttar Pradesh Assembly on Friday and then marched to their party headquarters at Lucknow's Vikramaditya Marg. SP tweeted a video of Yadav in which he said that the party is staging a walkout as it didn't get "any satisfactory answers from this government on various issues".

60.title: My 21-run over cost England the game: Moeen Ali on 2nd T20I vs Pak
60.article_body: England's stand-in captain Moeen Ali said the momentum of the second T20I against Pakistan changed after the 13th over of Pakistan's chase, where he conceded 21 runs. "It was under control for most of it. I genuinely feel my over lost the game for us...That was a gamble," added Moeen. "After...[my over] they were almost unstoppable," he stated.

61.title: SC to hear pleas against Article 370 abrogation after Dussehra break
61.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday said that it will list the hearing of pleas challenging the abrogation of Article 370 and the bifurcation of Jammu and Kashmir into Union Territories after the Dussehra break. "We will certainly list it," said a CJI UU Lalit-led bench. The Dussehra break will be from October 3 to October 9.

62.title: There are a lot of things which India need to improve: Reetinder Sodhi
62.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi said there are a lot of things which India need to improve before the T20 World Cup 2022. "There is no second thought that the Indian team is struggling at the moment," added Reetinder. "Our bowling struggled...[against Australia in the first T20I] while in Asia Cup, our batters were not at their best," he stated.

63.title: I had to do 'Bigg Boss' because there was no work for me: Rahul Dev
63.article_body: Actor Rahul Dev said that he had to do 'Bigg Boss 10' because there was no work for him. "Aur phir aap sochiye, itna kaam karne ke baad bhi 'Bigg Boss' (Despite having done all the work that I have, I had to do 'Bigg Boss')," he added. He further said he won't blame anyone because markets change pretty fast.

64.title: Attempts to corporatise power, agri sectors will prove disastrous: KTR
64.article_body: Telangana Minister for IT and Industries KT Rama Rao on Thursday alleged that the Centre is trying to privatise power and agriculture sectors which will have disastrous impact on farmers and others. "Telangana is a state where farmers cultivate lands relying on power supply. What would be the fate of farmers if free power is not supplied?" he further asked.

65.title: Body of person missing since September 4 found in Patna railway quarters
65.article_body: A dead body was found in Bihar's Patna railway quarters on Friday, police said. Reports said that the deceased had been missing since September 4. A search has been launched in the case and the body has been exhumed for a post-mortem. "We have received information that a dead body has been buried in the railway quarters," police said.

66.title: Residents oppose PCMC's move to not pick wet waste from Oct 2
66.article_body: Residents have opposed a decision by Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) to not collect wet waste from residential housing societies that produce more than 100 kg of waste from October 2. The societies said that the move will put an additional financial burden on them and instead suggested that the civic body should set up ward-wise wet waste processing plants.

67.title: Doing my own stunts is like doing math: Priyanka Chopra on 'Citadel'
67.article_body: Speaking about doing her own stunts in the Russo Brothers' 'Citadel', actress Priyanka Chopra said that it is like math, adding that if you train, you can do it. Filmmaker Anthony Russo added, "I like your analogy but, like math, not everyone can actually do it." Priyanka further said she was pulled in by "the social experiment of the show".

68.title: Delhi sees spike in dengue cases, experts say early prevention important
68.article_body: Delhi is witnessing a major spurt in dengue cases and experts are suggesting early prevention of the vector-borne disease amid incessant rainfall in the NCR region. "I am expecting the cases to go up in the next couple of weeks. So we need to be careful about it...We have to keep ourselves away from waterlogged places," said a doctor.

69.title: Digvijaya Singh confirms he won't run for Congress President post
69.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Friday confirmed that he will not be running for the party's President post in the upcoming election. He will follow instructions given to him by the higher authority in the party, he said at a press conference in Jabalpur. Meanwhile, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has confirmed he will contest the election.

70.title: No such thing happening: Madhur Bhandarkar on film with Kangana
70.article_body: Refuting reports of working with actress Kangana Ranaut, filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar said no such thing is happening right now and his concentration is only on Tamannaah Bhatia-starrer 'Babli Bouncer'. He further said it's wrong to say that films are not working, adding that 'RRR', 'Pushpa', 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'The Kashmir Files' did "wonders at the box office".

71.title: Centre urges nation to celebrate UNESCO’s recognition of Durga Puja
71.article_body: The Centre has urged everyone to celebrate the recognition of Durga Puja as the first Indian festival in UNESCO's Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity. "Nominating Durga Puja in Intangible Cultural Heritage list is country's pride. We have taken all the advices into consideration...It brings everyone together," said Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi.

72.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued in several states; IMD releases list
72.article_body: IMD has predicted isolated very heavy rainfall over Uttarakhand, West Bengal and Sikkim between September 23 and 25. Very heavy rainfall is also likely in Haryana and east Rajasthan on September 23 and west UP on September 24. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is predicted over Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, Chandigarh, east UP, Delhi and west Madhya Pradesh between September 23 and 25.

73.title: PM asked 'Jaage ho?': EAM on PM's midnight call during attack in Afghanistan
73.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar recalled an interaction with PM Narendra Modi when the latter called him past midnight during an attack in Afghanistan's Mazar-e-Sharif near Indian consulate, saying that the PM's first question was, "Jaage ho (Are you awake)?" Jaishankar added that he gave PM Modi updates, following which the PM asked him to call when it "all ends".

74.title: Let's not focus on negativity: Mouni on Kangana's remarks on 'Brahmāstra'
74.article_body: On being asked about actress Kangana Ranaut's remarks on the budget of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', actress Mouni Roy said let's not focus on the negativity. She further said that she feels humbled and is grateful to fans for their overwhelming love. Kangana had compared the film's box office collection with the budget and figures of 'The Kashmir Files'.

75.title: Fire breaks out at footwear manufacturing factory in Delhi's Narela
75.article_body: A fire broke out at a footwear manufacturing factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area on Friday, officials said. As many as 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot, Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said. "Fire is now under control, so far no injuries reported," it added. "The cramped conditions in the area make it hard to navigate," DFS stated.

76.title: I bought a ₹50,000 cream once, never again: Tabu on skincare
76.article_body: Speaking about her skincare routine, actress Tabu said she once bought a ₹50,000 cream recommended by her makeup artist, adding that she will never do it again. "Some days, I'll tell her that I put coffee here and some plant there and she'll say, 'You can't do that, you have to use this cream,' and...suggest some ₹50,000 cream," Tabu said.

77.title: 1 killed, 3 hurt as shed collapses at under-construction rice mill in Punjab
77.article_body: A 35-year-old labourer died and three others were injured after the shed of an under-construction rice mill collapsed in Punjab's Mohali on Thursday. About 30 people were working near the area at the time of the incident, a labourer said. According to police, the shed may have collapsed due to heavy rainfall. The injured were admitted to hospital, police added.

78.title: TV actress shares pic of fake Instagram mail for 'blue tick', says she shared her govt ID
78.article_body: TV actress Nupur Joshi has shared a screenshot of a fake Instagram email, seeking a copy of her identity proof in order to get a blue verification tick on her profile. "They sent me an email asking me about my government Identity proof. I was fooled and I'm scared as I don't know what's wrapped for the future," she wrote.

79.title: You can't show up in Mumbai and expect people to invest ₹100 cr in you: Angad
79.article_body: Speaking about actors needing to prove their mettle, actor Angad Bedi stated that you cannot show up in Mumbai and expect people to start investing ₹100 crore in you. "You need to prove yourself. Even after you have a successful film, you cannot sit back and relax. It is a new box office figure every day," the actor added.

80.title: Pune civic body to demolish 6 of 9 old sewage plants, build new ones
80.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has planned to demolish six sewage treatment plants (STPs), PMC electrical department head Shrinivas Kandul said. STPs at Erandwane, Vitthalwadi, Naidu Hospital, Bhairoba Nullah, Bopodi and Tanajiwadi will be demolished, he added. "As the technology upgradation cost...is high...consultant has proposed to demolish six of the nine STPs and set up new ones," Kandul stated.

81.title: 7 killed in landslides in El Salvador after days of rain
81.article_body: At least seven people have died after their homes were buried in landslides following four days of heavy rains in El Salvador, authorities said on Thursday. Among those killed, three are children. Authorities have declared an alert in 29 coastal municipalities and all municipalities in the department of San Miguel in the east of the country.

82.title: India need to make sure they don’t fall into trap of theories: Gavaskar
82.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Axar Patel being sent up the order ahead of Dinesh Karthik in the first T20I against Australia, Sunil Gavaskar said, "India need to make sure...they don't fall into the trap of theories." "If you think that...Karthik is a better batter than Axar, then he should come...[to] bat even if it's the 12th or 13th over," added Gavaskar.

83.title: 'Productivity paranoia' emerging between staff, managers: Nadella on hybrid work
83.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella told Bloomberg that a "productivity paranoia" between managers and employees is emerging amid hybrid mode of work. "Leaders think their employees are not productive, whereas employees feel they are being productive and in many cases even feel burnt out," he explained. Nadella said it is important to bridge this paradox in the new world of work.

84.title: Kirloskar proposes to divest 17.4% stake in Swaraj Engines to M&M
84.article_body: Kirloskar Industries has proposed to divest its 17.41% stake in Swaraj Engines to Mahindra & Mahindra at ₹1,400 per share. The stock of Swaraj Engines was trading 2.78% lower at ₹1,734.95 on NSE at 12:21 pm on Friday. Mahindra & Mahindra announced on Tuesday that it would acquire 17.41% equity of Swaraj Engines for total cash consideration of ₹296 crore.

85.title: Sachin Tendulkar dances down the track, smashes six off fast bowler; fans react
85.article_body: During the India Legends-England Legends Road Safety World Series match, Sachin Tendulkar danced down the track and smashed a six on the bowling of fast bowler Chris Tremlett, with a video of the shot going viral. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "Are we in 1998?" Another wrote, "Vintage Tendulkar." Tendulkar scored 40 runs off 20 deliveries in the match.

86.title: Shaheen jokes about Babar-Rizwan's world record partnership, calls them 'So selfish'
86.article_body: After Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan broke their own world record of highest-ever partnership (203*) in T20I cricket while chasing, Shaheen Afridi jokingly tweeted, "It's time to get rid of Kaptaan Babar & Rizwan." He jokingly added, "They're so selfish...If they would've played properly...match could've finished in 15 overs. They took it to...last over. Let's make this a movement...Nahi?"

87.title: ₹3,600 crore F-16 fighter jets assistance to Pak not designed as a message to India: US
87.article_body: Commenting on US' $450-million (over ₹3,600 crore) sustainment package for Pakistan's F-16 fighter jets, US Assistant Secretary of Defence for Indo-Pacific Security Affairs, Ely Ratner, said that the move was not designed as a message to India as a result of its relationship with Russia. Ratner also said that the US has a "limited security partnership" with Pakistan.

88.title: Father needs medical help: Jailed J&K separatist's daughter to PM
88.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah's daughter Ruwa Shah has written to PM Narendra Modi urging urgent medical attention for his father, who is lodged in Tihar jail. She said that her father, who is suffering from multiple illnesses, has been unwell for over two weeks and alleged that the jail authorities are underplaying his critical condition.

89.title: Ex-diplomat & US State Secretary's father Donald Blinken dies aged 96
89.article_body: Donald Blinken, an ex-US diplomat and father of US State Secretary Antony Blinken, has died aged 96. Blinken said his father, who served as US Ambassador to Hungary between 1994 and 1997, was "a source of love and inspiration". "Dad inspired me to public service," he added. Donald Blinken was the first US ambassador to receive Hungary's highest civilian honour.

90.title: India didn't dominate any period in Aus' run chase: RP Singh on 1st T20I
90.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh said Team India didn't dominate "any period" during the second innings of the first T20I against Australia, having scored 208 runs in the first innings. "Australia kept on hitting boundaries at regular intervals," added Singh. "The performance of the Indian team is dipping as we get closer to the T20 World Cup 2022," he stated.

91.title: Woman found hanging in Gurugram flat; live-in partner booked
91.article_body: A 33-year-old woman's live-in partner was booked after she was found hanging in her flat in Gurugram's Sector 81, police said on Thursday. The police said that a four-page suicide note was found which claimed that the man had promised to marry her but was already married and on being confronted, he, his wife and other family members beat her.

92.title: Rainfall to continue in parts of northwest India for next two days
92.article_body: Northwest India will continue to receive widespread rainfall for the next two days as a cyclonic circulation is hovering over northwest Madhya Pradesh and its surroundings. Several parts of Madhya Pradesh are expected to receive isolated heavy rainfall. Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan are also expected to receive heavy showers during the next few days.

93.title: Meta ordered to pay $174.5 mn for violating live-streaming patents in US
93.article_body: A US court jury has ordered Meta to pay walkie-talkie app maker Voxer $174.5 million in damages. The jury found that Meta violated two live-streaming patents developed by Voxer Co-founder Tom Katis, with Facebook Live and Instagram Live. Katis, a US Army veteran, had developed the patents as a way to solve battlefield communications problems he faced in Afghanistan.

94.title: SC transfers all FIRs against TV news anchor Navika to Delhi Police
94.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday clubbed all FIRs against TV news anchor Navika Kumar and transferred them to Delhi Police for the probe. Multiple cases were filed against Navika over remarks against Prophet Muhammad made on her show by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma. The court said no coercive action would be taken against her for eight weeks.

95.title: FTX in talks to raise up to $1 bn at $32 billion valuation: Report
95.article_body: Crypto exchange FTX is in talks with investors to raise up to $1 billion, CNBC reported. The Bahamas-based company is reportedly looking to keep its valuation at around $32 billion, which it achieved in a $400 million funding round in January. Founded in 2019, FTX counts Singapore's Temasek, SoftBank's Vision Fund 2 and Tiger Global among its investors.

96.title: Army Major booked for assaulting food delivery agent in Gurugram
96.article_body: The Gurugram Police on Wednesday booked an Army Major for allegedly assaulting a food delivery executive in September last year. According to the complainant, identified as Sonu, the incident occurred following an argument over using the service lift at a society. "He (accused) slapped me and I suffered some hearing loss due to an injury in my eardrum," Sonu added.

97.title: PFI's one-day Kerala 'bandh' over NIA raids turns violent; 2 policemen injured
97.article_body: The one-day 'bandh' in Kerala by the Popular Front of India (PFI) turned violent with incidents of stone-pelting and attacks on KSRTC buses reported from various parts. Notably, two policemen were injured after they were attacked by 'bandh' supporters in Kollam. The 'bandh' has been called after agencies like NIA and ED raided 93 PFI-linked locations across 15 states.

98.title: I had no work for a year before 'Jhalak...', swallowing meals was tough: Maniesh
98.article_body: Actor Maniesh Paul has revealed that he had no work for a year before he began hosting dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. "Swallowing meals would be tough. My wife was earning and so supportive throughout," he added. The actor further said that TV hosts face criticism for the buffoonery they indulge in, adding everything they do is for entertainment.

99.title: Apple's new iOS 16 update fixes camera shake issue, copy-paste bug
99.article_body: Apple has released a new iOS 16 update to fix some issues, including a camera problem that affected iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max. Users had complained about camera shaking when shooting with third-party apps like Instagram. The iOS 16.0.2 update also fixes a bug that sent multiple pop-ups, asking user's permission to copy and paste between apps.

100.title: Mahindra Finance stock falls 11% after RBI order on recovery agents
100.article_body: A day after RBI directed Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services to immediately stop any recovery operations through outsourcing arrangements, its shares fell over 10% on Friday. At 11:45 am, they were trading 11.44% lower at ₹198.10/share. RBI's directive came after a pregnant woman was allegedly run over by a tractor being forcibly driven away by loan recovery agents in Jharkhand.

101.title: 5-yr-old injured as Hyd bus driver loses control, hits bike; video surfaces
101.article_body: A five-year-old boy was injured after a TSRTC bus driver lost control of the bus and hit the motorcycle that the child was travelling on. A video of the incident surfaced online. The injured child has undergone two surgeries so far and is due for one more. The incident happened when the motorcycle tried overtaking the bus.

102.title: Proton VPN removes India servers, CEO says 'no intention to comply with govt order'
102.article_body: Proton, the Swiss company behind Proton VPN, has announced that it is removing its servers from India in response to a government order that requires service providers to store users' data. "Proton has no intention of ever complying with this or any other mass surveillance law," Proton CEO Andy Yen said. The order will come into effect on September 25.

103.title: Huge gold and copper deposits discovered in Saudi Arabia
103.article_body: Huge gold and copper deposits have been discovered in Saudi Arabia. The Saudi Geological Survey announced on Twitter that the discoveries of gold ore were within the boundaries of Aba al-Raha, in the Medina region. Copper ore was discovered at four sites in the Al-Madiq area in the Wadi Al-Faraa region in Madina, officials said.

104.title: Accenture's revenue for 4th quarter rises 15% y-o-y to $15.4 bn
104.article_body: IT services firm Accenture Plc's revenue increased by 15% year-on-year to $15.4 billion in the fourth quarter ended August, according to its filing. Its revenue from consulting was up 14% to $8.33 billion, while that from outsourcing increased by 16% to $7.09 billion. The Dublin-headquartered company's bookings increased by 22% to $18.4 billion, against the $16.99 billion estimate.

105.title: Urban ladder announces its biggest furniture sale of the year
105.article_body: Urban Ladder encourages people to get their houses ready this festive season. The Full House Sale is here to save the day, so customers can now buy queen beds under ₹10,000, sofas under ₹13,000 and avail insane deals from over 300+ brands, the brand said, adding that there’s no better time to start redecorating.

106.title: I don't think boycott thing works, biggest proof is Brahmāstra: Gaurav Chakrabarty
106.article_body: Actor Gaurav Chakrabarty said that he doesn't think the boycott trend really works, adding that Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmāstra' is the biggest proof. "People called for a boycott of this film but that was not successful," he added. The actor further said that 'The Kashmir Files' was called a propaganda film but it became a hit because people watched it.

107.title: Lion cub gets hit by train while crossing track in Gujarat, dies
107.article_body: A lion cub died after getting hit by a passenger train while crossing a railway track in Gujarat's Amreli on Thursday. Aged six to seven months, the cub was with a lioness and two other cubs, who managed to cross the track unhurt, according to an official. The train got delayed by about one-and-a-half hours due to the incident.

108.title: I sent a voice note to Raju Srivastava, he opened his eye a bit & then went away: Big B
108.article_body: Condoling actor-comedian Raju Srivastava's demise, Amitabh Bachchan wrote in his blog that he had sent a voice note to him. "They (family) got advised to send a voice to awaken his condition. I did and they played it for him...in his ears. On one instance he did open his eye a bit and then, went away," the actor wrote.

109.title: India reports 5,383 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 45,281
109.article_body: India has reported 5,383 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare's data. This comes a day after 5,443 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India. The active COVID-19 cases in the country now stand at 45,281. The number of coronavirus-related deaths so far has reached 5,28,449.

110.title: We won't oppose if Sachin Pilot is made Rajasthan CM: Congress MLA
110.article_body: Rajasthan MLA Rajendra Gudha, one of the six BSP turned Congress MLAs, said they won't oppose if Sachin Pilot is made the chief minister in case Ashok Gehlot becomes party chief. "Even if Bharosi Lal ji is made (CM) by Sonia ji, we're with him," Gudha added. Gehlot is likely to file nomination for party's presidential polls between September 24-28.

111.title: Farmers hold 'rail roko' protest, raise slogans against Punjab govt
111.article_body: Bharti Kisan Union (Ekta Ugrahan) on Thursday staged a three-hour 'rail roko' protest across the districts in Punjab and raised slogans against the state government. The farmers' union's head demanded that the state government provide ₹200 per quintal for paddy growers as an incentive to not burn stubble or else farmers will be forced to burn crop residue.

112.title: KSRTC driver wears helmet to save himself from stone pelting, video viral
112.article_body: A driver employed with Kerala State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) was seen wearing a helmet to save himself from stone pelting by PFI workers in Kerala. A video of him wearing the helmet was shared by several Twitter users. Reports said that almost a dozen KSRTC buses were damaged in stone pelting events recorded in Alappuzha, Kannur, Kozhikode, and Thiruvananthapuram.

113.title: Mizoram CM meets Amit Shah, discusses Myanmar refugee issue
113.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi to talk about the migration of refugees from the neighbouring Myanmar. Over 30,000 Myanmar nationals have reportedly taken shelter in Mizoram ever since the military seized power in February last year. Zoramthanga said that Shah agreed to visit Mizoram in November to open an Assam Rifles camp in Zokhawsang.

114.title: Delhi Police lists routes to avoid over waterlogging in many parts amid heavy rain
114.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police issued an advisory as heavy rain caused waterlogging in various parts of the national capital. It has asked commuters to avoid travelling on a stretch of Mahatma Gandhi Marg between Moti Bagh Junction to Dhaula Kuan. The traffic police have also asked the public to avoid stretches under Nizamuddin bridge, Singhu Border near petrol pump, among others.

115.title: TMC's Mahua shares pic of draft Telecom bill describing spectrum as 'atma, which is amar'
115.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra shared a pic of draft Telecom bill describing spectrum as "atma, which is ajar and amar". "Like atma, spectrum too does not have any physical form, yet it's omnipresent," the text in the bill read. "This isn't a spiritual text. It is Page 5 of Explanatory Note to Telecom bill uploaded on @DoT_India website," she tweeted.

116.title: Petrol-filled bottle hurled near BJP office in Coimbatore
116.article_body: A petrol-filled bottle was reportedly hurled near the BJP office in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore on Thursday night. Calling it a terror attack, the BJP workers staged a protest demanding action against the perpetrators. "Today raids [against PFI] took place at several places," said a party worker. The incident comes after nationwide raids against PFI by NIA, ED and police.

117.title: World must use military force if Iran builds nuclear weapon: Israel
117.article_body: The international community should respond with "military force" and not "words" if Iran develops nuclear weapons, Israeli PM Yair Lapid told the UN on Thursday. "The only way to prevent Iran from getting...nuclear weapon is to put a credible military threat on the table," Lapid said, adding Israel will do "whatever it takes" to ensure Iran doesn't get nuclear weapons.

118.title: They are decentralised Ponzi schemes: JPMorgan CEO on crypto
118.article_body: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon in a congressional testimony in US on Wednesday criticised cryptocurrencies and said they're "dangerous". "I'm a major skeptic on crypto tokens," he stated, adding, "They're decentralised Ponzi schemes, and the notion that's good for anybody is unbelievable." Dimon was speaking at a meeting of a committee that is working on a bill to regulate stablecoins.

119.title: 42-yr-old MNC employee falls from 9th floor of Noida building, dies
119.article_body: A 42-year-old employee of a multinational firm died after falling off the balcony of his ninth-floor apartment in Noida Sector-93B on Thursday. The deceased had reportedly moved to Noida earlier this month and was staying alone at the apartment. It's yet to be ascertained if it was an accidental death or if he deliberately jumped off the apartment, police said.

120.title: Helicopter carrying politicians gets stuck in wire & crashes in Brazil; video surfaces
120.article_body: A helicopter carrying politicians and other people crashed in Brazil's Minas Gerais after it accidentally made contact with a cable line while preparing to land on a football field. All four people in the helicopter survived and were rushed to a hospital for treatment. Deputy Mayor David Barroso was in ICU with fractured ribs, his office said.

121.title: I'm asked why I don't do more films in every language: Dulquer Salmaan
121.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said that people ask him why he doesn't do more films in every language. "This is a delightful problem I have...As opposed to, 'We are seeing too much of you'," he added. He further said he has the most pressure to have a big opening in Malayalam films so some of his decisions are based on that.

122.title: Why's Umesh playing? India have Shami, Chahar: Nehra on 1st T20I vs Aus
122.article_body: Ashish Nehra said he would like to know the reason behind Umesh Yadav being picked in the lineup for the first T20I against Australia, considering the presence of Deepak Chahar and Mohammad Shami. "If Chahar was fit...and Umesh has played ahead of him, then I am confused," added Nehra. "Chahar was [once] the frontrunner to replace Bhuvneshwar Kumar," he stated.

123.title: Man involved in house break-ins held in Pune; 8 theft cases solved
123.article_body: The Pune police's crime branch officials have arrested a 34-year-old man from Kothrud who was involved in various house break-ins in the city and adjoining districts. The police have solved eight theft cases following the arrest, which took place after police received a tip-off. Gold ornaments, silver ornaments and two motorcycles worth a total of over ₹10 lakh were recovered.

124.title: Ashok Gehlot confirms he will run for Congress President
124.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has confirmed that he'll run for Congress President. The process of filing the nomination will take place from September 24 to September 30 and the results will be declared on October 19. The scrutiny of nomination paper would be done on October 1 and the last date for the withdrawal of nominations would be October 8.

125.title: Audience loved 'Brahmāstra', a lot of critics banned it: Pooja Bhatt
125.article_body: Actress Pooja Bhatt has stated in an interview that the audience loved 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', while a lot of critics banned it. "I saw 'Brahmāstra' on the first day, first show...So that is why I say that quit the absolutes," the actress added. The Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer collected ₹360 crore worldwide in ten days of release.

126.title: Delhi-NCR sees waterlogging, traffic jams due to rain; yellow alert issued
126.article_body: Parts of Delhi-NCR witnessed waterlogging and traffic congestion at several places as heavy rainfall lashed the national capital and adjoining areas on Thursday. IMD, on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday, tweeted that more rainfall is expected in the area. A 'yellow' alert was issued for Friday. Schools in Noida were also shut for classes 1-8.

127.title: Can't blame 90s heroes for playing lovers, those films get made: Madhuri
127.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit stated that she doesn't blame 90s heroes for still doing romantic films because the commercial films being made require it. "They're always looking for something that keeps them young," she added. She further said the roles that she as well as actresses Juhi Chawla and Raveena Tandon are doing are because they are going forward in life.

128.title: BESCOM notifies areas to face power cuts this weekend in Bengaluru
128.article_body: Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) released a list of areas to be affected by power cuts this weekend owing to maintenance work. On Friday, areas under BESCOM's Kengeri and KB Cross divisions will be impacted. On Saturday, areas under KB Cross and Tumkur will see power cuts, while on Sunday, the Chandapura division will be impacted.

129.title: 'Brahmāstra' sequels will be darker and juicier: Ayan Mukerji
129.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has stated that 'Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev' will be a "darker and juicier" story in terms of dramatic conflict. He added that 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' was called 'Love' because that was the theme of the film. "Shiva has reached the height of his power...Now, we [go] further...with [Guru and Dev]," the filmmaker said.

130.title: Reliance New Energy to buy 20% stake in Caelux for $12 million
130.article_body: Reliance New Energy (RNEL) will invest $12 million into US-based Caelux Corporation to acquire a 20% stake. The transaction is expected to be completed by end of September 2022. A spin-out from the California Institute of Technology, Caelux is involved in the development of perovskite-based solar technology. Meanwhile, Reliance is setting up an integrated photovoltaic gigafactory in Gujarat.

131.title: Family tries to kidnap widow, minor son on way to HC in Chandigarh
131.article_body: Three people, including a widow's father and brother, were arrested after her family members allegedly attempted to kidnap her and her minor son while they were on the way to Punjab and Haryana High Court in Chandigarh with her lawyer. The family was threatening the woman to stop her from getting remarried, police said. The incident took place on Wednesday.

132.title: No one from Gandhi family will contest election for new Congress President: Ashok Gehlot
132.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said, "Rahul Gandhi made clear that no one from Gandhi family will contest election for new Congress President." "It's decided that I'll contest for the post. I'll fix the date to file the nomination soon. It's a need for the Opposition to be strong, looking at the current position of the country," he added.

133.title: US sanctions Iran's morality police after 22-yr-old woman's death
133.article_body: The US on Thursday imposed sanctions on Iran's morality police, accusing it of "abuse and violence against Iranian women". "The morality police are responsible for the...death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was arrested and detained for allegedly wearing a hijab improperly," US Treasury Department said. Amini's death in the custody of the morality police has sparked widespread protests in Iran.

134.title: BMC vaccinates 2,203 cows against lumpy disease in Mumbai
134.article_body: Amid the lumpy disease outbreak, the BMC has vaccinated 2,203 cows in Mumbai till now, while the remaining cows will be vaccinated by next week. According to the 2019 Animal Census, there are 3,226 cows and 24,388 buffaloes in the city. The vaccine has been developed by the National Equine Research Centre in collaboration with the Indian Veterinary Research Institute.

135.title: Singtel arm offloads 1.59% stake in Bharti Airtel for ₹7,261 crore
135.article_body: Singapore Telecommunications Limited's (Singtel) entity, Pastel Limited, divested a 1.59% stake in Bharti Airtel for ₹7,261 crore through an open market transaction, which has been picked by Bharti Airtel's promoter Bharti Telecom Limited. Pastel offloaded 9.4 crore shares at an average price of ₹772.5 apiece. With this Pastel's shareholding in Bharti Airtel will decrease to 10.62% from 12.21%.

136.title: Sensex falls 530 points to 58,589, Nifty opens below 17,600
136.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red amid weak global cues on Friday, with the Sensex falling 530 points to 58,589.40 and the Nifty below 17,600, at 17,478. HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, IndusInd Bank and Tata Motors were among the major Nifty losers, while stocks of Tata Steel, Cipla, Hero MotoCorp, Apollo Hospitals and JSW Steel gained.

137.title: RSS chief meeting Muslim cleric impact of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Congress
137.article_body: Congress leader Gourav Vallabh claimed the meeting between RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and the All India Imam Organization President is an impact of the party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "We would like to urge Mohan Bhagwat that if this 15-day yatra has had such an impact...[then] you should participate in the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' for an hour," Vallabh added.

138.title: 2 societies get Delhi HC nod to hold Ramleela events in parks
138.article_body: Delhi HC granted permission to two societies in Tri Nagar and Kirti Nagar to hold Ramleela and Dussehra events at two separate parks from September 24 to October 5. The court directed them to follow all safety norms. The societies approached HC after the Delhi Development Authority did not respond to their request when they applied for permission in August.

139.title: Nizam's 'serpent-sword' to return from UK, feature in Hyd museum
139.article_body: The sword of Nizam, shaped like a serpent, is set to be displayed at Hyderabad's Salar Jung Museum after its return from the UK. A 14th-century sword, it has serrated edges and gold etchings of an elephant and tigers. It is believed to have been gifted or sold by one of Nizam's officials to a British officer.

140.title: Aamir's daughter Ira gets engaged to boyfriend Nupur Shikhare; proposal video viral
140.article_body: Aamir Khan's daughter Ira Khan got engaged to her boyfriend Nupur Shikhare. The couple was attending one of Nupur's cycling events, during which he asked Ira to marry him. They shared the video of his proposal on social media and wrote, "Popeye: She said yes. Ira: Hehe I said yes."

141.title: Tejas equipped with world-class missiles: IAF official Syamantak Roy
141.article_body: Commanding Officer of 45 squadrons of the IAF Syamantak Roy hailed the Light Combat Aircraft Tejas and said that it is equipped with world-class missiles. "Tejas can carry 1000 pound conventional bombs along with laser guided bombs for precision targeting and overall air to air as well as air to ground weapons, which makes it a multirole aircraft," said Roy.

142.title: Millionaire who beat up his model ex-girlfriend, burned her face with iron in Italy jailed
142.article_body: British millionaire Ajaz Shah Hussain, who beat up his 27-year-old model ex-girlfriend and burnt her face with an iron, has been jailed in Italy for four years and eight months. The 37-year-old, dubbed as the 'Lamborghini stalker', was arrested in January 2021 after following her to Italy's Rimini in his Lamborghini. Police had seized his car.

143.title: South Korean President Yoon caught on hot mic calling US lawmakers 'f***ers'
143.article_body: South Korea's President Yoon Suk-yeol's remarks about US lawmakers were caught on a hot mic. Yoon reacted to US President Joe Biden's pledge to increase the US contribution to the UN Global Fund, which would require Congressional approval. "How could Biden not lose damn face if these f***ers do not pass it in Congress?" Yoon was heard saying.

144.title: Boat carrying migrants from Lebanon sinks off Syria, 34 dead
144.article_body: At least 34 migrants have died after a boat carrying migrants from Lebanon capsized off Syria's coast on Thursday afternoon. About 20 survivors are being treated in a hospital in Tartus, the Syrian Health Ministry said. Quoting survivors, officials said the boat was carrying between 120 and 150 people and had left crisis-hit Lebanon's northern Minyeh region "days ago".

145.title: Video shows sparks flying, burning debris falling from US flight after takeoff
145.article_body: A United Airlines flight made emergency landing at US' Newark airport after sparks flew off the plane shortly after takeoff. A video of the incident has surfaced online, which also shows burning debris falling from the aircraft. The flight circled over Atlantic Ocean to burn fuel before returning to the airport about two hours after departure, flight tracking data showed.

146.title: Rupee slips past 81 per US dollar for the first time ever
146.article_body: The Indian rupee declined past 81 per US dollar for the first time ever on Friday. The Indian currency depreciated 24 paise to a record low of 81.10 against the dollar in early trade. The currency had registered its biggest single-day fall in six months on Thursday, dropping to an all-time low of 80.86 against the dollar.

147.title: Thane man kills mother for rejecting his relationship with married cousin
147.article_body: A 29-year-old man from Thane's Bhiwandi area allegedly killed his mother after she rejected his relationship with his married cousin. According to police, Krishna Yadav along with his married cousin, attacked his mother when she was in deep sleep. Krishna then told police that his mother was killed during intervention when some men came to rob him near the building.

148.title: PFI to hold 'dawn-to-dusk hartal' today across Kerala against raids
148.article_body: Popular Front of India (PFI) has called for a 'dawn-to-dusk hartal' from 6 am to 6 pm on Friday across Kerala to protest against the raids by central agencies. As many as 93 PFI-linked locations across 15 states were raided on Thursday. "The hartal would be held against...fascist government's attempt to silence dissenting voices using central agencies," PFI said.

149.title: Hyderabad traffic police remove encroachments at Madina junction
149.article_body: The traffic police in Hyderabad removed the alleged encroachments at the city's Madina junction on Thursday. They cleared obstructions from the roads and footpaths. The officials interacted with street vendors and counselled them to not block the roads and make arrangements for proper parking in order to avoid causing obstructions for commuters.

150.title: Ranbir didn't charge anything, Brahmastra couldn't be made without it: Ayan
150.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji said that actor Ranbir Kapoor did not charge anything for the making of 'Brahmastra'. He said the film has been made from personal sacrifices. "It is a very very big thing because it would not have been possible without this kind of support and I don't know how many other people would have done this," he added.

151.title: Gangster's illegally built house demolished in Gurugram's Manesar
151.article_body: An illegally built four-storey house allegedly owned by gangster Sube Singh Gujjar, who is currently in jail, was demolished in Bar Gujjar village in Gurugram's Manesar on Thursday. The house and its boundary wall were razed in the presence of over 50 police personnel. "Gujjar has been involved in criminal activities for...last 20 years," ACP (Crime-I) Preet Pal said.

152.title: New batch of online degrees at Manipal University Jaipur starts soon
152.article_body: Manipal University Jaipur shared that it will commence classes for the new batch of its UGC-entitled online degrees in October 2022. With admissions closing soon and very few seats left, the University announced that students can enroll now to avail benefits like free Coursera access, professional certification courses worth ₹50,000, and a vast alumni network.

153.title: Person using electricity illegally assaults MSEDCL staffer in Pune
153.article_body: A person who was using electricity illegally was arrested for allegedly assaulting a 39-year-old senior technician of Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) with an iron rod when the latter went to disconnect the illegal power supply in Pune's Viman Nagar. The incident occurred after the accused's power supply was cut for not paying bills, officials said.

154.title: Poland distributes iodine pills amid fighting near Ukraine nuclear plant
154.article_body: Amid fighting around Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in neighbouring Ukraine, Poland has distributed iodine tablets to regional fire departments to give to people in the event of radioactive exposure. "These are routine, pre-emptive actions," Poland's Deputy Interior Minister Blazej Pobozy said. Iodine is considered a protective substance against conditions that result from radioactive exposure.

155.title: 4 killed as portion of building collapses in Thane's Ulhasnagar
155.article_body: Four people, including three from a family, lost their lives after a slab from the fourth floor of a building collapsed on the ground floor in Maharashtra's Thane district on Thursday. The incident reportedly occurred around 2 pm at Manas Tower, a five-storied building in camp five area of Ulhasnagar. According to police, several flats in the building were vacant.

156.title: 5 arrested for kidnap, attempt to murder of auto driver in Pune
156.article_body: Pune Police arrested five persons for allegedly kidnapping and attempting to murder a 22-year-old autorickshaw driver. The accused tortured and attacked him with an iron rod and sickle while he was in captivity, police added. "The accused wanted to avenge the suicide of their family member, who, they believed, took his own life due to the autorickshaw driver," police stated.

157.title: Mumbai to get black bins for hazardous waste, 3-bin policy to be implemented
157.article_body: A three-bin policy will be rolled out in Mumbai in December, reports said. Black bins will be set up for the disposal of hazardous waste. BMC has decided to make this policy mandatory for housing societies instead of the two-bin policy. "Vehicles carrying dry and wet waste will have a separate section to segregate home hazardous waste," an official said.

158.title: Bengaluru's Koramangala gets mini waste transfer station
158.article_body: A mini waste transfer station for transporting wet waste collected door-to-door was inaugurated in Bengaluru's Koramangala on Wednesday. Congress' BTM Layout MLA Ramalinga Reddy, who inaugurated the station, said it has a capacity to hold 25 to 28 tonnes of garbage daily. The facility will reduce roadside black spots and avoid leachate spilling from compactors, he added.

159.title: Iran Prez cancels interview in US after journalist refuses to wear headscarf; she shares pic
159.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi cancelled an interview with journalist Christiane Amanpour after she refused to wear a headscarf. "We are in New York, where there is no law or tradition regarding headscarves," she said. This comes amid protests in Iran after 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who was arrested by morality police for "unsuitable attire" died in police custody.

160.title: Woman presses clutch instead of brakes, runs over delivery boy in Thane
160.article_body: A 40-year-old woman ran over a 19-year-old delivery boy after she seemingly pressed clutch instead of brakes in her car in Thane. A resident of the locality said the woman was not able to control her car and ran over the boy, who died in the incident. Victim was delivering groceries to the residents and was returning to the shop.

161.title: AIIMS doctor, sister arrested for cheating partner of ₹16 cr in Delhi
161.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a doctor from All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) and his sister for cheating another doctor of approximately ₹16 crore. Both the accused were arrested from a resort in Tamil Nadu while they were trying to escape the investigation. "It's a case of cheating...on the basis of forged documents...causing wrongful loss to the partner," police said.

162.title: Tata Steel to be merged with 7 metal companies of Tata Group
162.article_body: Tata Steel on Friday announced the merger of seven of its group companies and itself in an attempt to consolidate its business. Under this scheme of amalgamation, Tata Steel Long Products, The Tinplate Company of India, Tata Metaliks, TRF Limited, The Indian Steel & Wire Products, Tata Steel Mining and S&T Mining Company will be merged with Tata Steel.

163.title: Hawker gropes 21-year-old student on Mumbai local train, arrested
163.article_body: A hawker has been arrested for allegedly groping a 21-year-old nursing student on a local train in Mumbai last week. He had reportedly boarded the train at Nahur station and was selling accessories in the ladies' compartment. The victim said she gave the hawker the benefit of doubt when he first touched her. However, he groped her again, she added.

164.title: Man misbehaves, abuses female security guard at Greater Noida society
164.article_body: A man allegedly misbehaved with a female security guard at a residential society in Greater Noida after she reportedly "did not open the gate" for him to enter. The man was enraged and verbally abused the newly-hired guard when she enquired about his flat number. When the guard and those around her objected, the man threatened to beat them up.

165.title: 22-yr-old man leaks nude pics of Delhi-based girlfriend after breakup, arrested
165.article_body: A 22-year-old sketch artist from Jharkhand has been arrested for allegedly leaking nude pictures of his Delhi-based girlfriend. The woman was in a relationship with the accused, who she had met on Instagram. On their first meeting, she found her nude photos on his phone and broke up with him. Infuriated with this, he leaked her photos on social media.

166.title: Self-proclaimed godman rapes woman on pretext of exorcism in Ghaziabad
166.article_body: A self-proclaimed godman has been arrested for allegedly raping a woman under pretext of performing exorcism in Ghaziabad. The woman, who was unwell for days, had visited the accused with her husband for treatment. He told her that she was in possession of a spirit and needed to stay with him, following which he held her hostage and raped her.

167.title: 25-yr-old drug addict stabs friend to death over ₹500 in Delhi; arrested
167.article_body: A 25-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly stabbing his friend to death over ₹500 in Delhi. According to police, both of them were drug addicts, and on September 18, a minor argument broke out between them over drugs. The accused told police that the deceased had given him ₹500 to bring drugs, and they had an altercation over it.

168.title: NCP leaders protest against stray animal hospital project in Hadapsar
168.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leaders staged a protest against Pune Municipal Corporation's proposal of opening a hospital in Hadapsar for animals, mainly strays. They demanded to shift the project to another locality amid resistance by locals. The leaders were also protesting against garbage projects in Hadapsar. Local MLA Chetan Tupe questioned, "Why should we bare the whole city's garbage?"

169.title: Man donates his liver, sells land to save 6-month-old son in Bengaluru hospital
169.article_body: A man from West Bengal whose six-month-old son underwent surgery for biliary atresia, a rare liver disease that affects one in 12,000 children, at a private hospital in Bengaluru donated a part of his liver to save him. He also sold his land to pay ₹15 lakh for the surgery. "My son's alive...and this is what matters," Suraj Babsha said.

170.title: Flight operations at Mumbai airport to remain suspended for 6 hrs on Oct 18
170.article_body: Flight operations at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) will remain suspended between 11:00 am and 5:00 pm on October 18 due to maintenance work on the airport's two runways. The work includes work of upgradation of aeronautical ground lights. CSMIA said it has already rescheduled flights to ensure smooth completion of maintenance work.

171.title: Find 20 'most bad' roads, prepare plan to fix them: HC to BMC, Maha PWD
171.article_body: Bombay High Court on Thursday asked Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) Commissioner Iqbal Chahal and Maharashtra Public Works Department (PWD) Secretary to identify 20 "most bad" roads in Mumbai and prepare a plan to fix them. As authorities had earlier cited monsoon as an impediment to repair roads, HC said, "Now the monsoon has gone. So that can't be an issue."

172.title: Tesla recalls nearly 1.1 million vehicles in US to update window reversing software
172.article_body: Tesla is recalling nearly 1.1 million vehicles in US because the window automatic reversal system may not react correctly after detecting an obstruction, increasing risk of injury. Tesla said it would perform an over-the-air software update of the automatic window reversal system. The recall covers some 2017-2022 Model 3, 2020-2021 Model Y and 2021-2022 Model S and Model X vehicles.

173.title: Pantaloons announces Grand Online Festive Sale with deals at 40-70% off
173.article_body: Pantaloons has announced its Grand Online Festive Sale featuring deals & offers with 40-70% off. With an aim to encourage people to wear latest ethnic outfits for festivities, customers can choose from a wide range of categories like kurtas, suits, footwear & more. Customers can also avail extra ₹500 off on shopping for ₹2799 & above using Coupon Code: GOFS500.

174.title: Noida schools for classes 1-8 to remain closed tomorrow due to heavy rain alert
