174.article_body: Schools for classes 1 to 8 will remain closed across Noida and Greater Noida on September 23 (Friday) in the wake of a heavy rainfall alert, District Magistrate Suhas LY announced on Thursday. Incessant rains in Delhi NCR since Thursday morning caused traffic jams. The weather department has issued a 'yellow' alert in Delhi for Friday.

175.title: Pakistan record their highest opening partnership in T20I cricket history
175.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday recorded their highest-ever opening partnership in T20I cricket. Muhammad Rizwan and Babar Azam shared an unbeaten 203-run opening stand against England in the second T20I to set the record. The previous record was also held by Muhammad Rizwan and Babar Azam, who shared a 197-run stand for opening wicket against South Africa on April 14, 2021.

176.title: Rape not confirmed in case of 15-yr-old girl seen walking naked in video: Moradabad Police
176.article_body: After registering a case of alleged gangrape of a 15-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Moradabad, police said no evidence of sexual assault was found during the medical examination. The police added that the girl's parents stated that she has mental health issues. This comes after a video of the girl walking naked had surfaced on social media.

177.title: Six people killed by elephants in Karnataka’s Mudigere: MLA
177.article_body: Legislator in Karnataka’s Mudigere, MP Kumaraswamy, on Thursday said violent elephants in his constituency have killed six people and destroyed some houses. “Elephant population is increasing, their foeticide…or shifting…is also not happening,” Kumaraswamy said in the state Assembly. He demanded compensation for those farmers who couldn’t take up sowing because of the elephants.

178.title: BJP to come to power in Telangana: Minister Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti
178.article_body: Minister of State for Rural Development Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti on Thursday criticised Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao for allegedly not fulfilling his promises and added that BJP would come to power in the state. Mentioning Uttar Pradesh government's bulldozer drive against corrupt people, the BJP leader asked the public in Telangana, "Do you want that kind of government or not?"

179.title: ₹58,521 cr lost due to illicit trade in 5 key industries including FMCG: Report
179.article_body: According to a FICCI report, the government suffered a tax loss of ₹58,521 crore in 2019-20 due to illicit trade in goods in five key industries, including FMCG, mobile phones, tobacco products and alcohol. The illicit market across industries was valued at ₹2.60 trillion. Tobacco products and alcoholic beverages accounted for nearly 49% of the overall accounted loss.

180.title: Air India signs deal to replace 34 old engines
180.article_body: Air India signed an agreement with Willis Lease Finance Corporation to sell 34 old CFM56-5B engines and lease back their replacements. The old engines have been powering Air India's four A320ceo aircraft and 13 A321ceo aircraft. Air India's Chief Commercial Officer Nipun Aggarwal said the deal would allow Air India to reduce maintenance costs and avoid unpredictable upkeep visits.

181.title: Why aren’t India, Japan & Ukraine UNSC permanent members: Zelenskyy
181.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has questioned why countries like India, Brazil, Japan, and his own are not the UN Security Council’s (UNSC) permanent members. Zelenskyy made the remark in a pre-recorded message for a UN General Assembly session on Wednesday. “There was a lot of talking about reforming the UN. How did it all end? No result,” Zelenskyy said.

182.title: Gurugram offices advised to work from home amid rain alert tomorrow
182.article_body: The Gurugram Disaster Management Authority on Thursday advised all corporate offices and private institutions in the district to guide employees to work from home in the wake of a heavy rainfall alert on Friday. This has been decided to avoid traffic congestion and undertake repair work. The Delhi-Gurugram expressway was flooded after heavy rains on Thursday.

183.title: Indian startups raised over $995 million VC funding in August: Report
183.article_body: GlobalData said that 128 Indian startups have raised over $995 million (around ₹8,000 crore) in venture capital funding in August. The amount was 9.7% higher than what was raised in the previous month. According to the data and analytics company, India saw the announcement of 1,239 VC funding deals from January to August 2022.

184.title: IKEA India raises ₹600 crore to increase presence in country
184.article_body: Swedish furniture retailer IKEA's Indian unit raised ₹600 crore, according to financial data accessed by business intelligence platform, Tofler. Ingka Pro Holding BV, The Netherlands and Ingka Holding Overseas BV were the investors for IKEA. The Ingka Group, the owner and operator of IKEA Retail, has planned to open two shopping destinations in NCR via Ingka Centres.

185.title: Saudi Arabia to start programme to send woman astronaut into space
185.article_body: Saudi Arabia on Thursday said it will start a training programme with the aim to send a woman astronaut into space by next year. The programme will be part of the kingdom’s Vision 2030 plan. The first Arab to go to space was Saudi Arabian Prince Sultan bin Salman in 1985 as part of a NASA mission.

186.title: Instagram down for several users in India & many parts of the world
186.article_body: Facebook-owned photos and video sharing platform Instagram suffered an outage in India and other parts of the world. For multiple users, the outage is causing direct messages (DMs) to load slowly or not load at all. Several other users are reporting that their feed is not being able to load.

187.title: Pitbull dog attacks cow in Uttar Pradesh, refuses to let go of its jaw; video surfaces
187.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a pitbull dog attacking a cow in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. In the video, the dog can be seen refusing to let go of the cow's jaw despite attempts by its owner and other locals. After continuous efforts by the owner and locals, the cow was rescued from the pitbull.

188.title: Kaneria trolls Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey, says 'It looks like watermelon'
188.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Danish Kaneria trolled the team's T20 World Cup 2022 jersey, saying it looks like a watermelon. "It seems they got...inspiration while playing Fruit Ninja," he added. He further said, "There should have been a proper dark green colour instead of what they went ahead with. This one makes you feel like you are standing at a fruit shop."

189.title: TVS Motor gets shareholders' nod for stake sale in Sundaram Holding
189.article_body: Two and three-wheeler manufacturer TVS Motor has received shareholders' approval for the sale of its entire 50.05% stake in its subsidiary Sundaram Holding USA Inc (SHUI), the company informed the stock exchanges on Thursday. TVS Motor will sell the stake to Sundaram-Clayton Limited (SCL), the holding company. It will reportedly receive ₹317.01 crore from the disposal.

190.title: It gives ventilation: Amitabh Bachchan on why he wore harem pants to KBC
190.article_body: Explaining why he wore harem pants to 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' months back, Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan said he saw some men wearing those while he was shooting in Rishikesh. "As...wind blew, the pants would also flow...I liked them...so I was like 'humko bhi ye...chahiye (I want them for myself). Thoda ventilation ho jaata hai (It provides ventilation)," he said.

191.title: Dangerous 'forever chemicals' found in school uniforms: Study
191.article_body: According to new study, children who wear stain-resistant school uniforms may be exposed to potentially dangerous levels of 'forever chemicals', also known as polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS). "PFAS don't belong in any clothing...School uniforms are worn directly on the skin for up to eight hours per day by children, who are particularly vulnerable to harm," researcher Marta Venier said.

192.title: Durga puja celebrations shouldn't inconvenience anyone: WB CM
192.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said Durga Puja committees must take steps to ensure that pedestrian and vehicular traffic movement are regulated well, without anyone having to encounter much hassle. Inaugurating Sreebhumi Sporting club puja in Lake Town area, Banerjee said, "I will be monitoring the situation from home. Hence, my action will be prompt and swift."

193.title: Restrain AAP from publishing defamatory allegations: L-G to Delhi HC
193.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena urged the Delhi High Court on Thursday to restrain the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) from publishing "defamatory" and "malicious" allegations against him and his family. AAP has accused Saxena of being involved in a ₹1,400 crore scam during his tenure as the Khadi and Village Industries Commission chairman. The HC has reserved its order.

194.title: L Nageswara Rao appointed by SC to oversee IOA elections
194.article_body: Former Justice L Nageswara Rao has been appointed by the Supreme Court to conduct the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) elections. A bench of justices DY Chandrachud and Hima Kohli gave the direction. Earlier, the International Olympic Committee (IOC) directed the IOA to address governance issues and said failure to hold elections could result in its suspension.

195.title: India is a civilisation democracy: Assam CM Sarma
195.article_body: Speaking at the third edition of the 'Lokmanthan' convention, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said India is a "civilisation democracy" and "not a constitutional democracy". He said a collective response is required to tackle the "attack" of the Left and secularists on "Indian civilisation". He further added that "India is not a union of states but our living motherland".

196.title: Madras HC permits RSS to take out procession in Tamil Nadu
196.article_body: The Madras High Court has granted permission to the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) for carrying out a procession at 50 locations in Tamil Nadu on October 2. RSS workers will wear uniforms and be led by a musical band and conduct public meetings thereafter. The state has been directed to impose restrictions to maintain law and order.

197.title: UK deepening links with fellow democracies like India: Liz Truss
197.article_body: UK Prime Minister Liz Truss said her country is deepening links with “fellow democracies like India, Israel, Indonesia and South Africa”. Truss was addressing the UN General Assembly’s 77th session on Wednesday. Truss said the UK “won’t be strategically dependent on those who seek to weaponise the global economy”, in a reference to Russia amidst the Ukraine war.

198.title: India in touch with UK to prevent further attacks: MEA on Leicester row
198.article_body: After a temple was vandalised in Leicester, Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Thursday stated that Indian mission is in touch with UK authorities to prevent further attacks. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar discussed the security of Indians in UK with British minister James Cleverly. Apart from Leicester, disorder was reported near a Hindu temple in Birmingham.

199.title: Massive traffic jam on flooded Delhi-Gurugram expressway after heavy rains
199.article_body: A massive traffic jam was witnessed on the Delhi-Gurugram expressway amid severe waterlogging due to incessant rainfall in Gurugram on Thursday. Pictures and videos shared on social media show the vehicles moving bumper to bumper. Several people were seen walking in knee-deep water as the expressway was flooded after the rainfall.

200.title: Time has come to save democracy, secularism from BJP-RSS: Yechury
200.article_body: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Thursday criticised the ruling BJP and said that time has come to save democracy, secularism, the Constitution and the country from BJP-RSS. Speaking at the party's state-wide rally in Bihar, Yechury said all the left and secular forces in Bihar and throughout India will come together against PM Narendra Modi in 2024 general elections.

201.title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat visits madarsa in Delhi, interacts with students
201.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday visited the Azad Market Madarsa Tajweedul Quran in Delhi and interacted with the teachers and students there. Bhagwat reportedly asked the students to focus on their education, stating that they're the future of the country. "RSS Sarsanghchalak meets people from all walks of life," an RSS official said about Bhagwat's visit.

202.title: 2 teenagers feared dead after being swept away in Saryu river in UP
202.article_body: Two teenagers, aged 15 and 17, were feared dead after being swept away in Saryu river in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia, where they had gone to take a bath, police said. The victims were identified as Kishan Kumar and Avnish Kumar. "While two of them managed to come out of the river, Avnish and Kishan could not be traced," SHO said.

203.title: Punjab AAP stages protest after Governor calls off session for trust vote
203.article_body: Punjab Aam Aadmi Party took out a protest march after Governor Banwarilal Purohit withdrew the state government's order calling for a special Assembly session to hold a trust vote on Thursday. However, the AAP MLAs' protest march was stopped by police ahead of Raj Bhawan. They held banners against the BJP that read "Killer of democracy".

204.title: I'm working hard to prove that I deserve it: Shanaya on 'Bedhadak'
204.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor's daughter Shanaya Kapoor, who will make her Bollywood debut with 'Bedhadak', has said that she wants people to feel that she earned this opportunity through her performance. "I'm working...hard to prove that I deserve it...[and] I didn't waste it or that I didn't take it for granted," she added. The film is produced by Dharma Productions.

205.title: Meta sued for tracking iPhone users despite Apple's privacy rules
205.article_body: Meta was sued for allegedly tracking data of iPhone users despite safeguards launched by Apple. Two Facebook users accused Meta of violating state and federal laws in a class-action complaint in San Francisco federal court where a similar complaint was filed last week. Apple's privacy changes cost Meta $10 billion in its first year, according to a report.

206.title: Johnny Depp dating lawyer Joelle Rich who represented him in UK trial: Reports
206.article_body: Johnny Depp is dating attorney Joelle Rich, who represented him in his UK libel trial against The Sun, as per reports. The London-based lawyer is reportedly married but separated at the time. Earlier, Depp sparked dating rumours with attorney Camille Vasquez who represented him in his US defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. Vasquez had, however, refuted the rumours.

207.title: India-Brazil-S Africa trilateral meeting held in New York
207.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar, Brazil’s Foreign Affairs Minister Carlos Alberto França and South African Health Minister Joe Phaahla met on Wednesday for the 10th IBSA Trilateral Ministerial Commission in New York. “The Ministers expressed satisfaction on the coordination…among IBSA countries in various multilateral fora,” read a joint statement after the meeting.

208.title: SoftBank cuts valuation of IPO-bound OYO to $2.7 billion, OYO responds
208.article_body: After SoftBank cut its estimated value for OYO to $2.7 billion, the hotel booking firm said, "Confident that speculation...about...valuation markdown is patently incorrect." It added, "Valuation is an outcome of business performance. As per our latest audited results...we've clocked ₹7 crore maiden adj EBITDA profit in June quarter...These are dramatically improved results."

209.title: One-in-a-million spirit bear spotted in US, pic goes viral
209.article_body: An extremely rare bear has been spotted in the US for the first time in more than fifteen years, appearing for the very first time in Michigan. The Kermode bear, also known as spirit bear, was captured on a trail camera. Researchers said that the blonde-coloured animal is genetically a "one-in-a-million" bear.

210.title: People walk in knee-deep water on Delhi-Gurugram expressway amid heavy rain
210.article_body: The Delhi-Gurugram expressway was flooded after heavy rainfall in Gurugram on Thursday caused waterlogging. The motorists on the stretch faced traffic issues while some people were seen walking in knee-deep water. Motorists struggled to drive on the inundated stretch. Pictures and videos that surfaced online showed severely inundated lanes and main roads.

211.title: Can't do projects that require 45-day shoots due to daughter: Neelam
211.article_body: Actress Neelam Kothari Soni said her nine-year-old daughter takes up most of her time. "I can't sign a project that would require me to shoot 40-45 days and not be there for her," she added. However, she stated she'll make time if an "extremely interesting" project comes her way. Neelam will next be seen in 'Made in Heaven' season 2.

212.title: Crew members teared up during Diljit's hair-cutting scene: Jogi director
212.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar revealed his crew members were in tears while shooting Diljit Dosanjh's hair-cutting scene for 'Jogi'. "Diljit was the first one to tell me this scene is the soul of the film," he added. Ali stated, "I told my technical crew, 'I'd have one take, do whatever you have to do'...I said 'lock your cameras and leave'."

213.title: Do not look for quick-fix solutions: HDFC CEO Keki Mistry to CFOs
213.article_body: The CEO of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC), Keki Mistry, has said that Chief Financial Officers (CFOs) should not look for quick-fix solutions. He said, "Short-term solutions will never help you in the long run." Profits can be enhanced by taking on risks in the financial services sector, he said, adding that there's a need to focus on long-term stability.

214.title: Bihar has become a sleeper cell for terrorists: Giriraj Singh
214.article_body: Panchayati Raj Minister Giriraj Singh on Thursday stated that Bihar has become a sleeper cell for terrorists. The BJP leader also accused Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav of encouraging the workers of Popular Front of India (PFI) and patronising the Islamic organisation as a cultural organisation. PFI wants to make Purnia its centre, Singh alleged.

215.title: India 'strongly' calls for immediate end of Ukraine war at UNSC
215.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, while speaking at United Nations Security Council (UNSC) briefing on Ukraine on Thursday, said, "India strongly reiterates the need for an immediate cessation of all hostilities & return to dialogue & diplomacy." He added, "Clearly, as PM Narendra Modi has emphasised, this cannot be an era of war."

216.title: Why raids against PFI, what's their crime: SP MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq
216.article_body: Samajwadi Party MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq on Thursday questioned multi-agency raids against the Popular Front of India (PFI), asking what their crime is and why people associated with it are being arrested. "Like all other institutions of the country, PFI is also an institution," Rahman said. "This organisation is fighting the problems faced by Muslims of the country," he added.

217.title: India should be a permanent UNSC member: EAM Jaishankar
217.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said India not being a permanent member of the UN Security Council (UNSC) is “not good for us” and “not good for the global body”. He said the world body’s transformation is overdue. Jaishankar made the remarks while in a conversation with former Vice Chairman of NITI Aayog Arvind Panagariya at the Columbia University.

218.title: FS Life raises ₹50 cr in pre-Series B funding round
218.article_body: FS Life (previously FableStreet) has raised ₹50 crore in its pre-Series B funding round. The round was led by Fireside Ventures and saw participation from startup owners Ghazal Alagh Co-founder, Mamaearth and Mehul Agrawal and Vikram Chopra Co-founders, CARS24, among others. The startup was founded in 2016 by Ayushi Gudwani as an apparel brand that is now a multi-brand organisation.

219.title: Punjab AAP MLA Ugoke's father allegedly attempts suicide; hospitalised
219.article_body: Punjab AAP MLA Labh Singh Ugoke's 65-year-old father allegedly attempted suicide by consuming a poisonous substance, police said. However, the AAP leader said his father's heart rate had dropped due to which he was admitted to hospital. Ugoke defeated former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi from the Bhadaur seat of Barnala district in the Assembly polls this year.

220.title: Ola Electric forays to international markets; signs MoU with Nepal
220.article_body: Ola Electric CEO Bhavish Aggarwal announced that the EV manufacturer would be foraying into international markets beginning with Nepal. Aggarwal said the company has signed an MoU with CG Motors in Nepal making them the local distributors for Ola's scooters. "Our international expansion...a testament to the fact that India will lead the EV revolution for the world," he said.

221.title: World Bank approves loan worth $350 million for Gujarat
221.article_body: The World Bank's Executive Board of Directors has approved a loan of $350 million for Gujarat. "[It'll help Gujarat] to improve the quality and access of its public healthcare services, with special focus on adolescent girls and disease surveillance," it said. The loan will be utilised through the state government's Systems Reform Endeavours For Transformed Health Achievement In Gujarat Programme.

222.title: Former Tripura CM Biplab Deb elected as Rajya Sabha MP
222.article_body: Former Tripura CM Biplab Kumar Deb has been elected to the Rajya Sabha on the lone seat in the state that went for by-election. The BJP leader polled 43 votes, 36 of BJP and seven of its ally Indigenous People's Front of Tripura. Following his victory, he tweeted, "Under [PM Narendra Modi's leadership], we'll...take NorthEast to newer heights of progress."

223.title: 2,600-year-old-cheese found inside ancient clay pots in Egyptian tomb
223.article_body: Archaeologists have discovered several blocks of Halloumi cheese dating back 2,600 years in clay pots in an ancient tomb in the Saqqara necropolis in Egypt. Halloumi is a traditional Cypriot cheese with a high melting point made from a mixture of goat's and sheep's milk, and sometimes cow's milk. A researcher said ancient Egyptians referred to Halloumi cheese as 'Haram'.

224.title: Arunachal Pradesh increases excise duty on liquor by 15%
224.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Cabinet has increased the existing excise duty on all hard liquor by 15%, to be paid before the import or removal from the manufacturer. The excise duty for military or paramilitary units shall be 50% of the rates of the excise duty fixed. The decision will lead to Indian-made foreign liquor (IMFL) being costlier in the state.

225.title: Exercise extreme caution before taking up IT job offers in Thailand: Govt to Indians
225.article_body: The External Affairs Ministry urged Indians to exercise "extreme caution" before taking up IT job offers in Thailand. Workers are being lured with highly lucrative data entry jobs in Thailand and then illegally taken across the border to a remote area in Myanmar for forced labour, the ministry said. The ministry has facilitated the rescue of some of these victims.

226.title: Delhi government's education model 'collapsing': Delhi BJP chief
226.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Thursday claimed the education model of the Delhi government is "collapsing". Gupta claimed that the schools run by the AAP government in Delhi lack infrastructure, which can be seen from the condition of the schools at Khajoori Khas in the trans-Yamuna area. He further accused the Delhi government of indulging in corruption.

227.title: Will prefer to die in democratic India over artificial China: Dalai Lama
227.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama on Thursday said that he'd prefer to breathe his last in the "free democracy" of India than "artificial" China. "India is surrounded by people who show love...At the time of death...one must be surrounded by trusted friends," he said. He made these remarks during an interaction with youth leaders at his Dharamshala residence.

228.title: Roger Federer shares selfie with Team Europe ahead of last match of his career
228.article_body: Roger Federer took to Twitter to share selfie with Team Europe ahead of the last match of his career. In the picture, Federer can be seen posing with Laver Cup teammates and Cameron Norrie, with London's Tower Bridge in background. Federer will team up with Rafael Nadal and face Team World's Jack Sock and Frances Tiafoe in doubles match tomorrow.

229.title: Which states in India have the highest unemployment rate and which have the lowest?
229.article_body: As per the latest data released by the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE), Haryana (37.3%) has the highest unemployment rate among Indian states and UTs, followed by Jammu and Kashmir (32.8%), Rajasthan (31.4%) and Jharkhand (17.3%). Chhattisgarh has the lowest unemployment rate (0.4%), while Meghalaya and Maharashtra have unemployment rates of 2% and 2.2%, respectively.

230.title: Rice production to drop by 6% this Kharif: Agriculture Ministry
230.article_body: Rice production in the Kharif season of 2022-23 will be 104.99 million tonnes (mt), which is 6% lower than last season's production, the Union Ministry of Agriculture said in its estimates report. In the last Kharif season, 111.76 mt rice was produced. The ministry said this season's estimate is 4.40 mt higher than the average of last five years.

231.title: Tata Group airlines partner with CSIR-IIP for sustainable future
231.article_body: Air India, AirAsia India and Vistara (Tata Group airlines) have joined hands with the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research - Indian Institute of Petroleum for the development of sustainable aviation fuels (SAFs). The bodies also decided to work together in several other areas related to sustainable aviation. SAFs can be blended with fossil jet fuel to reduce emissions.

232.title: Saturn's moon Enceladus more habitable than previously thought: Study
232.article_body: Researchers have found that the subsurface ocean of Saturn’s moon Enceladus is rich in dissolved phosphorus, an essential ingredient for life, making it more habitable than previously thought. After analysing the samples of plumes of ice grains and water vapour from the surface of the planet, researchers said, "We've learned...that the plume contains almost all the basic requirements of life."

233.title: PM Modi to visit Japan for state funeral of Japan's ex-PM Shinzo Abe
233.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Japan on September 27 to attend the state funeral of former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, the Ministry of External Affairs said on Thursday. He will also separately meet Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida during the visit. Abe was assassinated in July. Notably, protests were held in Japan against the state funeral.

234.title: NASA's Artemis I hit with more hydrogen leaks during cryogenic test on Sept 21
234.article_body: NASA's Artemis I sprouted more fuel leaks during the cryogenic test on September 21. "Hazardous hydrogen fuel began escaping at the same place...same time as before, despite new seals and other repairs," the launch director said. "Engineers halted the flow and warmed the lines in hopes of plugging the leak...But the leak persisted before dropping to acceptable levels," he added.

235.title: Man chokes minor sons to death before hanging self over family feud in Raj
235.article_body: A farmer in Rajasthan's Jodhpur allegedly choked his two minor sons to death before hanging himself over some family disputes. The bodies of the deceased were initially found by the man's wife. Upon hearing the woman's cries, villagers gathered and informed the police. The woman said she'd gone to the field with her husband but he had come back earlier.

236.title: Who is Neha Narkhede, the youngest self-made woman entrepreneur on Hurun India Rich List?
236.article_body: Neha Narkhede, Co-founder of Confluent, a streaming data technology company, is the youngest self-made woman entrepreneur on Hurun India Rich List 2022. The 37-year-old Indian-American grew up in Pune, and studied Computer Science at the Georgia Institute of Technology. She has been ranked 336 with estimated wealth of ₹4,700 crore. Narkhede earlier worked for Oracle Corporation and LinkedIn.

237.title: People don't want to be told what's true or false: Microsoft Prez on censorship
237.article_body: Microsoft President Brad Smith said he believes that people don't want governments or technology companies to tell them what is true or false. This comes as Microsoft announced that it won't label social media posts that appear to be false in order to project the company's stand against online censorship. Microsoft's primary goal is to be "transparent", Smith said.

238.title: Jharkhand and Bihar are now free of Naxals: CRPF DG
238.article_body: Director-General of CRPF Kuldiep Singh said Jharkhand and Bihar are now free of Naxals after security forces cleared the forested area of Buddha Pahad in Jharkhand. Singh said the forces, aided by an MI-17 helicopter, reached the area on Monday and set up a permanent base camp there. Home Minister Amit Shah congratulated the security personnel for the successful operation.

239.title: Aamir Khan praised me for 'Jamtara' on text, I replied 'Who Aamir?': Sparsh
239.article_body: 'Jamtara' actor Sparsh Shrivastava revealed Aamir Khan praised him for his performance in the series on text. "I thought 'Why'd Aamir Khan talk to me?' So I replied to him asking 'Who Aamir Khan?'," he added. Sparsh said Aamir video called him and added that he began shivering and was speechless after he saw the actor on the other side.

240.title: Mahindra in talks to raise up to $500 million for EV push: Report
240.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra is in talks with global green funds and private equity firms to raise between $250-$500 million to accelerate its plans to build EVs, Reuters reported quoting a source. It reportedly wants a long-term investor to help build its EV business. Mahindra's new EV unit for which it's raising the capital was valued at $9.1 billion in July.

241.title: Alcohol not bad, consumed by big doctors & officers: Gujarat AAP leader
241.article_body: AAP leader Jagmal Vala, who is contesting the upcoming Gujarat Assembly election, has said that alcohol isn't bad and even big doctors, IAS and IPS officers consume it. "It is only in Gujarat, with a population of 6.5 crore, where alcohol is prohibited," he said. BJP spokesperson Yagnesh Dave asked him to apologise for defaming the state through his remarks.

242.title: Stop loan recovery through outsourcing arrangements: RBI to Mahindra Finance
242.article_body: The RBI has directed Mahindra & Mahindra Financial Services to immediately cease carrying out any recovery or repossession activity through outsourcing arrangements. The company, however, may continue to carry out recovery activities through its own employees. The directive comes days after a pregnant woman died in Jharkhand after she was allegedly run over by a tractor by loan recovery agents.

243.title: ED attaches ₹2,747-cr assets of ABG Shipyard in money laundering case
243.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) attached ₹2,747 crore in assets of ABG Shipyard Limited and its associate firms on Thursday in a money laundering case. The assets include a shipyard in Gujarat, plots in Maharashtra and Gujarat and bank accounts of the company. The ED had launched the money laundering investigation based on an FIR registered on February 7.

244.title: Pak's ISI considers me an enemy: Indian-American lawmaker Krishnamoorthi
244.article_body: Indian-American lawmaker Raja Krishnamoorthi said that Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) considers him an "enemy" owing to his stance on the radicals in Pakistan. "[Krishnamoorthi] reiterated that he respect(s) all religions and [has] never discriminated against any...race or religion," a statement by US India Security Council read. Krishnamoorthi represents the Democratic Party in US.

245.title: Bengal govt which 'banned' Durga Puja is taking UNESCO credit: Lekhi
245.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi on Thursday claimed that the Mamata Banerjee-led West Bengal government that "banned" Durga Puja and idol immersion is taking credit for the festival's inclusion in a UNESCO list. Durga Puja was inscribed on the UNESCO Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 2021. Notably, the West Bengal government restricted idol immersion in 2017.

246.title: Assembly session dedicated to women will inspire people: UP CM
246.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath said the special session dedicated to women in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly on Thursday will become an event that will inspire people for a 100 years from now. "Today, the largest legislature of the country is moving towards creating a new history," he said. During the special session, only women members were allowed to speak.

247.title: Police book 4 furniture stores in Hyderabad for road encroachment
247.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police have booked four furniture stores for encroaching the road and the footpath at Lakdikapul. The stores would obstruct traffic and pedestrians by placing their loading and unloading vehicles on the road, along with putting their cane furniture on the main road and sidewalk. The complaint was filed under Section 341 of the IPC against the stores.

248.title: Court issues notice for carbon dating of 'Shivling' in Gyanvapi row
248.article_body: A Varanasi court has issued a notice to the Muslim side for carbon dating of the 'Shivling' allegedly found in the Gyanvapi mosque complex. The Hindu side filed an application demanding the carbon dating and the court demanded objections from the Muslim side. The court also denied the Muslim side eight weeks to prepare for the next hearing.

249.title: Happens due to lot of pressure: Suryakumar Yadav on Rohit's viral expressions on field
249.article_body: Reacting to Rohit Sharma's expressions on the field during the first T20I against Australia, which went viral on social media, Suryakumar Yadav said, "These things happen on the cricket field because at times there is a lot of pressure." Further, talking about Rohit jokingly grabbing Dinesh Karthik's head and jaw, Suryakumar said, "That was their banter."

250.title: UK to probe cloud services dominance of Amazon, Google & Microsoft
250.article_body: With Amazon, Google and Microsoft dominating cloud services, Britain said that it would investigate competition in the market. Communications regulator Ofcom said that it would investigate digital communication platforms such as WhatsApp, Zoom and FaceTime. It plans to publish a final report in 12 months and would recommend policy changes if the cloud market wasn't working well.

251.title: Agritech startup Deep Rooted raises $12.5 mn in Series A round
251.article_body: Farm-to-consumer firm Deep Rooted has raised $12.5 million in a Series A funding round. The round, led by IvyCap Ventures, saw participation from existing investors Mayfield, Accel and Omnivore. The agritech startup was founded by Santosh Narasipura, Gururaj Rao, Avinash BR and Arvind Murali. Earlier, Deep Rooted managed 100 acres of greenhouses and supplied vegetables and fruits to restaurants.

252.title: I'm not demeaning but still honest while reviewing SRK's films: Gauri
252.article_body: Gauri Khan, during her appearance on the show 'Koffee With Karan 7', said she has to be "real" when her husband and actor Shah Rukh Khan shows her his films. "It has to be what I feel and...the truth," she added. "I won't be harsh...I won't be...demeaning...I put it across in a way, I'll still be honest," Gauri further stated.

253.title: 57% of Bengaluru residents not satisfied with governance: Survey
253.article_body: Fifty-seven percent of Bengaluru residents are not satisfied with the overall governance of the city, according to a survey conducted by the Bangalore Political Action Committee. The main grievances were the condition of roads, public toilets, quality of drinking water, and waste disposal. The responses of 8,405 people were recorded in the survey from February to June this year.

254.title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.8 hits Mexico, 2nd major quake this week
254.article_body: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck Mexico on Thursday, causing at least two deaths and damaging buildings. Two people died- a woman who fell down the stairs of her home and a man who had a heart attack. The earthquake struck near the epicenter of a magnitude 7.6 quake that hit three days earlier in the western state of Michoacan.

255.title: Instagram working on filter to protect users from nude pics: Report
255.article_body: Instagram is working on a new filter to protect users from receiving unsolicited nude photos in their chats, according to a report. Instagram-parent Meta has reportedly confirmed that the feature, which will automatically cover photos that may potentially contain nudity, is in the early stages of development. Photos would remain covered unless a user chooses to view them.

256.title: Bank of England raises interest rate to 2.25% from 1.75%
256.article_body: Bank of England (BoE) raised its key interest rate from 1.75% to 2.25% on Thursday and said it would continue to "respond forcefully, as necessary" to inflation. BoE's Monetary Policy Committee also voted unanimously to reduce its government bond holdings worth £838 billion by £100 billion over the coming year. Inflation in October to peak at about 11%, BoE said.

257.title: 'Justice for SSR' campaign is purely agenda-driven: Swara Bhasker
257.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said 'Justice for SSR' campaign on Twitter is agenda-driven. "It's a...well-thought-out, organised campaign...once you understand what that agenda is...who is funding it, you get the whole picture," she added. The campaign began after Sushant Singh Rajput passed away in 2020. "I told my colleagues in the industry...they're making a big mistake by staying silent," she stated.

258.title: There should be zero tolerance towards communalism: Rahul on PFI raids
258.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday reacted to the crackdown on the Popular Front of India (PFI) by the National Investigation Agency (NIA), stating that there should be "zero tolerance" towards communalism. "Communalism, regardless of where [it comes] from, should be combatted," he added. As many as 106 activists of the PFI have been arrested for allegedly supporting terror activities.

259.title: Shrikant Tyagi, who abused woman at Noida society, gets bail
259.article_body: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who was arrested by Uttar Pradesh Police for allegedly abusing and assaulting a woman in Noida's Grand Omaxe society last month, was granted bail by the Allahabad High Court on Thursday. Tyagi was also accused of using UP government stickers on his vehicles.  Among other cases, a case of impersonation was also registered against him.

260.title: No one from Gandhi family will contest Cong Presidential polls: Digvijaya Singh
260.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Thursday said that no one from the Gandhi family will contest in the upcoming party Presidential polls. When asked about his intention to contest, he said, "I'll do whatever...Congress President orders me to do." "The Gandhi family has made many sacrifices," he said, asserting that the era of the Gandhi family will never end.

261.title: Amazon to set up 3 solar farms in India with capacity of 420 MW
261.article_body: E-commerce giant Amazon has announced it'll set up three solar farms in India. The solar farms will be set up in Rajasthan with a combined capacity of 420 megawatt (MW). Notably, this will be the first time when Amazon would set up a solar farm in India. Further, the company would set up 23 new solar rooftop projects in India.

262.title: 28-yr-old man kills 70-yr-old grandmother in Chennai, arrested
262.article_body:
A 28-year-old man, R Sathish, was arrested in Chennai for allegedly murdering his 70-year-old grandmother, S Visalatchi, who wanted him to repay the money she had lent him, police said.
The woman was attacked with a hammer and a blade at her home, after which Sathish escaped from the spot. Visalatchi was taken to a hospital, where she died later.

263.title: A gas cylinder exploded, everyone got distracted: Afridi on tampering pitch in 2005
263.article_body: Recalling himself tampering pitch in a Test against England in 2005, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "The ball was neither turning nor swinging...Suddenly...a gas cylinder exploded and everyone got distracted." He added, "I told Shoaib Malik, 'I want to create patch on this pitch'...Malik replied, 'Do it, no one is watching'...so I did that! And then...what happened is history."

264.title: Expect 'one person, one post' stand to be respected: Rahul on Cong Prez polls
264.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that he expects the 'one person, one post' stand to be respected when it comes to the Congress President post. He added that the post of Congress President is not just a position but a belief system that represents India. The post of Congress President is an ideological one, he said.

265.title: 110-year-old Rupee Co-operative Bank in Pune to shut down today
265.article_body: Pune's Rupee Co-operative Bank, which was established 110 years ago as part of the Swadeshi movement, is set to shut down today (Thursday). The Reserve Bank of India cancelled its licence last month because it didn't have adequate capital. Notably, many high-value depositors still hold around ₹340 crore in deposits. They would only be reimbursed up to ₹5 lakh each.

266.title: 7 inmates of Vadodara jail drink soap water after clash with jail officials
266.article_body: Seven undertrials were hospitalised after they drank soap water in Vadodara jail. The inmates facing charges under Gujarat Control of Terrorism and Organised Crime Act weren't allowed to have tiffins from outside, so they'd take tiffins of other undertrials. When authorities tried sending them to different barracks, a clash erupted between them, following which they drank soap water in protest.

267.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar's wife responds after trolls mock cricketer for expensive spell
267.article_body: India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar's wife Nupur Nagar took to Instagram to respond to trolls mocking her husband over his expensive spell in first T20I against Australia. "Nowadays, people are so worthless, that they have nothing better to do and have so much time to spread hate and envy," she wrote. She added that nobody cares about the existence of trolls.

268.title: Delhi-Gurugram expressway waterlogged after rains; video surfaces
268.article_body: The Delhi-Gurugram expressway was inundated due to waterlogging after heavy rains in Gurugram on Thursday. A video shows people wading through knee-deep water on the expressway. The waterlogging also led to traffic congestion in the area and vehicles were seen running bumper to bumper on the waterlogged expressway.

269.title: Maha's Laxmi co-operative bank's licence cancelled, depositors can claim up to ₹5 lakh
269.article_body: The RBI has cancelled the licence of the Laxmi Co-operative Bank Limited, Solapur, Maharashtra. The bank is prohibited from accepting and repayment of deposits with effect from the close of business on September 22, 2022. On liquidation, every depositor would be entitled to receive deposit insurance claim amount of deposits up to ₹5 lakh, the RBI said.

270.title: Chaos for India vs Aus 3rd T20I tickets in Hyd, 20 injured in stampede
270.article_body: Police resorted to lathi charge to disperse the crowd that had gathered outside Hyderabad's gymkhana ground to purchase tickets for the 3rd T20I, to be played between India and Australia. The stampede-like situation left 20 people injured, of which seven were shifted to a nearby hospital, reports said. Hyderabad is hosting an international match after a gap of three years.

271.title: Tharoor’s only contribution in last 8 yrs was sending letters to Sonia: Cong leader
271.article_body: Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh on Thursday backed Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot as "a better candidate" than Shashi Tharoor for the party's President post, alleging that the two candidates can't even be compared. He said Tharoor's only major contribution to the party in the last eight years was sending letters to Congress Interim President Sonia Gandhi when she was hospitalised.

272.title: IIT Bombay canteen worker did not record or leak any video: Police
272.article_body: After a canteen worker at IIT Bombay was accused of filming a student while she was in the hostel bathroom, Mumbai Police said no such video has been found on his phone. "We...sent his phone to the forensic laboratory. So far, we found that [he] didn't record any video and leak it. This was a rumour," DCP Maheshwar Reddy said.

273.title: PFI office in Hyderabad sealed by the NIA, raids conducted
273.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has raided multiple locations linked to the Popular Front of India (PFI) in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana and has also sealed the organisation's office in Hyderabad. A notice was put on the sealed office in Chandrayangutta area of Hyderabad's old city. The building's owner was asked to approach the special NIA court at Nampally.

274.title: Woman beats husband, his lover with slipper after catching them in Agra hotel
274.article_body: A woman caught her husband red-handed with his alleged lover in a hotel room in Agra. The incident, caught on camera, shows the man's wife catching the duo together inside the room and then thrashing them with her slipper. The husband can be seen apologising on camera while the woman repeatedly requests for calling the police.

275.title: My vision is to do a female-led massive action film: Tamannaah Bhatia
275.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia has said that her vision is to do a female-led action film. "I want to do films which I like to watch...I really want to do some hard-hitting action on-screen," she added. Tamannaah, who will feature in Madhur Bhandarkar's 'Babli Bouncer', said she gets bored as an actor if she does similar roles too often.

276.title: Traffic jams in Delhi-NCR as rain causes waterlogging
276.article_body: Different parts of the national capital on Thursday faced traffic jams after moderate rainfall caused waterlogging in Delhi-NCR. The traffic police have issued alerts, warning commuters to avoid the stretch between Phirni Road and Tooda Mandi Red Light and Najafgarh due to waterlogging. Waterlogging also affected traffic at Mahipalpur Red Light and Moti Bagh Junction towards Dhaula Kuan.

277.title: UK lifts moratorium on fracking to bolster energy security
277.article_body: The British government on Thursday lifted its ban on fracking, saying the aim is to bolster its energy security amidst tensions with Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. The Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy said fracking proposals will be considered at locations which have "local support". The UK had banned fracking in 2019 over environmental concerns.

278.title: Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya shares 1st pic of her newborn baby
278.article_body: Actor Rajinikanth's daughter Soundarya Rajinikanth took to Twitter and shared the first picture of her newborn baby boy Veer Rajinikanth Vanangamudi. In the picture, Soundarya can be seen holding her baby, whose face is hidden with an emoji, with her father Rajinikanth standing behind her. Along with the picture, Soundarya thanked everyone who wished her on her birthday.

279.title: Anonymous hacks Iranian websites over death of 22-yr-old woman in custody
279.article_body: Hacker collective Anonymous said it hacked Iranian government websites, taking them offline, over 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death in police custody. Amini died after allegedly being assaulted by police over "improper hijab". Anonymous said Amini's death was the "last straw" and that it had launched '#OpIran' against Iran. "Anonymous won't keep Iranian government alive on the internet," it said.

280.title: 100 Cong legislators to paste 'PayCM' posters in B'luru: Cong leader
280.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar has said that 100 MLAs and MLCs will paste 'PayCM' posters in Bengaluru as a mark of protest against BJP after the arrest of eight Congress workers. Bengaluru Police arrested eight Congress workers for putting up the 'PayCM' posters, Shivakumar said, adding that a CM has to digest such political criticism in a democratic country.

281.title: PDS rice worth ₹4.19 lakh seized in Telangana's Jangaon, 6 held
281.article_body: The Task Force police on Wednesday arrested six persons in Telangana's Jangaon and seized 131 quintals of rice worth ₹4.19 lakh meant for distribution under the Public Distribution System. Two mini trucks and a motorcycle were also seized, Additional DCP and Task Force incharge Vaibhav Gaikwad said. The accused, along with the seized rice, were handed over to Zaffergadh Police.

282.title: Bengaluru Police arrest two Congress activists in 'PayCM' probe
282.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested the Karnataka Congress' social media coordinator BR Naidu and an IT cell member of the party, Gagan Yadav, on late Wednesday night for allegedly circulating the 'PayCM' posters in the city. The posters accused Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai of corruption. Bommai had earlier ordered a probe into the posters and called them a tactic to defame him.

283.title: Cong President's post a belief system, represents vision of India: Rahul
283.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that the post of Congress President is a belief system that represents a vision of India. "The Congress President is not just an organisational post, but an ideological one," he added. He said that he expected all party members to respect the 'one person, one post' decision.

284.title: Passenger held at Hyderabad airport, 300 gm gold worth ₹15 lakh seized
284.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport apprehended a female passenger arriving from Dubai who was smuggling gold and seized 300 grams of gold worth ₹15.45 lakh. The passenger was trying to smuggle the gold bars by concealing them in their underwear, Customs officials tweeted. A case has been booked and investigation is going on.

285.title: Mohan Bhagwat is 'Rashtra pita': All India Imam Organization chief
285.article_body: After meeting RSS head Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday, All India Imam Organization chief Imam Umer Ahmed Ilyasi called him "Rashtra pita". "Mohan Bhagwat ji visited on my invitation today. He is 'Rashtra pita' and 'Rashtra rishi'. A good message will go out from his visit," Ilyasi said. "Our ways of worshipping god are different but...biggest religion is humanity," Ilyasi added.

286.title: Maha govt to invite fresh bids for Dharavi redevelopment project
286.article_body: The Maharashtra cabinet on Wednesday decided to invite fresh bids for the redevelopment of Dharavi, one of Asia's largest slum clusters in Mumbai, a statement said. The state government has decided to include land acquired from the railways in the project and offer additional concessions to prospective developers. The project has been in the making for over two decades.

287.title: Russia orders airlines to stop selling tickets to men aged 18-65 amid war: Report
287.article_body: Kremlin has reportedly ordered Russian airlines to stop selling international flight tickets to men aged 18-65. This comes amid reports that the citizens have been scrambling for flights out of Moscow after President Vladimir Putin said the country will mobilise reservists to fight in Ukraine. Only men who have approval from Russia's government will be allowed to leave, said reports.

288.title: Commuters walk on tracks after local train services delayed in Mumbai
288.article_body: Commuters were seen walking on railway tracks in Mumbai after Central Railway's local train services were delayed due to signal problem between Dadar and Parel railway stations on Thursday morning. Pictures showed people walking on tracks between Sion and Matunga railway stations. Many commuters changed trains on track, while some even boarded a moving train.

289.title: Crypto taxation startup Binocs.co raises $4 mn in seed funding round
289.article_body: Cryptocurrency taxation startup Binocs.co has secured $4 million in a seed funding round led by BEENEXT, along with Arkam Ventures, Accel, Saison Capital, Premji Invest, Blume Ventures and Better Capital. Binocs.co, a Web3.0 portfolio tracking platform, was co-founded by Tonmoy Shingal and Pankaj Garg. The company is looking to expand its operations in the US, UK, South Africa and Australia.

290.title: SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son to discuss alliance between Arm & Samsung
290.article_body: SoftBank Group Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son will discuss a "strategic alliance" between Samsung Electronics and British chip designer Arm during his visit to South Korea first time in three years. Arm's parent SoftBank had planned its sale to NVIDIA for $40 billion, however, the deal fell through following an outcry from Arm's customers. Arm sells and licenses semiconductor technology.

291.title: Housing societies protest against PCMC's decision to not lift wet waste
291.article_body: Housing societies under Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation protested against the civic body's decision to stop collecting wet garbage from the societies. Notably, PCMC has identified 700 big housing societies that generate over 100 kg waste daily and said it wouldn't lift wet waste from these societies from October 2. It has asked the societies to process wet waste within their premises.

292.title: I think Ananya Panday dated 2 guys at same time: Karan Johar to Bhavana
292.article_body: On the show 'Koffee With Karan 7', Gauri Khan said that she would advise her daughter Suhana to not date two guys at the same time. Reacting to it, Karan Johar told Bhavana Pandey, "I think Ananya has already done that. She was oscillating." To this, Bhavana replied, "She was thinking of two, so she could break up with one."

293.title: Will use guerrilla tactics: Team Thackeray on denial of Dussehra rally venue
293.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, while responding to the Mumbai civic body's decision to deny them permission to hold a Dussehra rally, said that it was a "very bad script of the BJP". Sena leader Ajay Choudhari said that they will resort to "guerrilla warfare tactics" to hold their rally. Both Sena factions were denied permission to hold their rallies.

294.title: Toyota's Oct-Dec output likely to decline amid chip shortage
294.article_body: Toyota has said it expects to produce about 850,000 vehicles worldwide per month on average from October to December due to semiconductor shortages. Last month, Toyota said it aimed to produce about 900,000 vehicles per month on average from September to November. Toyota has not changed its global vehicle production target for current financial year, keeping it 9.7 million units.

295.title: 60-yr-old man kills wife, dies by suicide in Pune
295.article_body: A 60-year-old man reportedly died by suicide after killing his wife in Pune on Wednesday. "Preliminary investigation suggests...the husband strangled and hit the wife with a wooden stool leading to her death," police said. They also found a note, believed to have been written by the man, which points to a discord between the two over some personal issues.

296.title: 18-yr-old girl thrown into air after getting hit by car in B'luru; video surfaces
296.article_body: An 18-year-old woman was thrown into air after being hit by a car on Bengaluru's Bellari road. The incident happened when the woman and another person were trying to cross the road. The woman suffered severe injuries and is now being treated at Baptist Hospital. In March, a 14-year-old student was killed by a speeding truck on the same road.

297.title: Going to win Oscar: Chris Evans on Ana De Armas' Marilyn Monroe role in 'Blonde'
297.article_body: Chris Evans has said he predicted Oscar for Ana De Armas when she showed him a picture of herself as Marilyn Monroe from the screen test of Andrew Dominik directorial 'Blonde'. "I remember looking at it and saying...'You're going to win an Oscar for this'," Evans said. He said playing Monroe was Armas' one of the first "incredibly demanding" opportunities.

298.title: WhatsApp Pay India head Manesh Mahatme quits after 18 months: Report
298.article_body: WhatsApp's India payment business head Manesh Mahatme has reportedly quit the company after an 18-month stint. Going by his LinkedIn profile, he joined WhatsApp Pay in April 2021 and worked until September 2022. He is also said to be joining Amazon India. Before joining WhatsApp, Mahatme was a Director and board member of Amazon Pay India for nearly seven years.

299.title: Govt failed to protect, secure the nation on every front: Congress
299.article_body: Congress spokesperson Abhishek Manu Singhvi on Wednesday alleged that the central government has failed to protect and secure the country on every front, from national security to food security. He said the government is attempting to divert the attention of people from its "inefficiency" through ED raids. Singhvi added that incidents of crime against women are rising under BJP government.

300.title: Govt may allow joint IPs between foreign firms, Indian startups: MoS IT
300.article_body: Minister of State for Electronics and Information Technology, Rajeev Chandrasekhar, has said the Indian government is mulling over making provisions to create joint intellectual properties (IPs) between foreign companies and Indian startups. The ministry said it is working to create a space for artificial intelligence and deep-tech startups by providing them capital support and market access.

301.title: 25 shops in Thane develop cracks after railway work leads to road cave in
301.article_body: As many as 25 shops in Thane's Waghoba Nagar developed cracks on Thursday after a nearby road caved in, civic authorities said. No injuries were reported, the authorities added. The cracks developed due to digging work being undertaken near the tracks by the railways to construct a protection wall, Thane Municipal Corporation's Regional Disaster Management Cell Chief Avinash Sawant said.

302.title: Astounded by Saif's research for his role: 'Vikram Vedha' directors
302.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' directors Pushkar and Gayatri said they were "astounded" by the "rigorous research regimen" Saif Ali Khan followed to adapt an encounter specialist cop's persona. They said Saif's preparation to become Vikram also included practice with real weapons. "Saif's passion towards his craft is visible in his body language in the film," they added.

303.title: Pepperfry to file draft IPO documents in next quarter: Report
303.article_body: Furniture and home goods e-commerce firm Pepperfry will file draft papers for an Initial Public Offering (IPO) in the October-December quarter, as per a report. The company plans to list on the markets by next year. It has appointed JP Morgan and ICICI Bank to lead the IPO. Earlier this year, Pepperfry delayed its IPO owing to adverse markets.

304.title: 3 men looking for friend's address thrashed on suspicion of child-lifters in MP
304.article_body: Three men were thrashed by a group of people on suspicion of being child-lifters in MP's Bhopal on Tuesday. The men were looking for a friend's address when the incident took place. Some people called the police, who rushed to the spot and intervened to stop the attack. A case has been registered against the attackers.

305.title: Infosys shares fall to 16-month low as IT stocks face margin woes
305.article_body: Infosys Limited shares hit a 16-month low on Thursday and also fell to a 52-week low of ₹1,360 apiece, a level last seen on May 25, 2021. At 1:04 pm, it was trading at ₹1,369.95 a share, down 0.53% on the National Stock Exchange. This comes even as IT stocks are facing pressure amid margin worries and global economic uncertainties.

306.title: Let's make sure 'RRR' gets Oscars nomination: 'Don't Look Up' director
306.article_body: 'Don't Look Up' director Adam McKay said 'RRR' not being picked as India's official entry to Oscars 2023 is a "travesty". "But let's make sure it gets a Best Picture nomination [at Oscars]. Can we do a screening at the Rose Bowl? (How amazing would that be?)," he tweeted. Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' is India's official entry to the Oscars.

307.title: Traffic diversions to be in place at Delhi airport Terminal 1D from Monday
307.article_body: The Delhi airport authority announced traffic diversions at Delhi airport's Terminal 1D starting Monday due to ongoing expansion work. Vehicles coming to T1 departures will have to make a u-turn at the end of the forecourt ramp and exit through the newly widened up-ramp to take Mehram Nagar road, airport officials said.

308.title: Delhi Police bust int'l drug cartel, arrest 2 with drugs worth ₹60 cr
308.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell on Thursday busted an international narcotics cartel and arrested two key members of the group. The accused were arrested from Bihar's Muzaffarpur and have been identified as Abhishek Raja and Nizamuddin. The police have also seized 10 kilograms of heroin and 10 kilograms of opium, estimated to be worth more than ₹60 crore from the accused.

309.title: Zetwerk reports operating loss of ₹42 cr in FY22, revenue up 6 times
309.article_body: Business-to-business (B2B) unicorn startup Zetwerk reported an annual operating loss of ₹42 crore in FY22 as against a loss of ₹43 crore in the previous year. This was led by a rise in non-cash employee stock option plan expenses. The 2018-founded startup's operating revenue grew six times to ₹4,961 crore in FY22 as against ₹835 crore in the previous year.

310.title: Freedom of speech 'non-negotiable, uncompromising': VP Jagdeep Dhankhar
310.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday said freedom of speech is a "non-negotiable and uncompromising" asset of India. "If we depart from this, we'll compromise with the sovereignty and wholesomeness of the country," Dhankhar added. He further stressed upon the role of intellectuals as very critical and urged them to engage in proactive dialogue, debate and discussion.

311.title: Man posing as PA to Congress MP dupes local of ₹2.50 lakh in Ludhiana
311.article_body: A man, posing as the personal assistant to Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu, allegedly duped a local resident of ₹2.50 lakh in Ludhiana, police said. The accused promised the victim a government job in the building branch of Ludhiana Municipal Corporation, police added. The accused allegedly demanded ₹2.50 lakh for the task, police further said.

312.title: Supreme Court extends stay on IHH's open offer for Fortis Healthcare
312.article_body: The Supreme Court extended a stay on IHH Healthcare's open offer for Fortis Healthcare and directed Delhi High Court to look into the issue. With IHH acquiring 31% stake in Fortis in 2018, a mandatory open offer for IHH to acquire another 26% stake in Fortis was triggered. Fortis' stock fell 20% to an intraday low of ₹250.35/share on Thursday.

313.title: You could not finish me and won't be able to do it later: Fadnavis to Uddhav
313.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis took a jibe at former CM Uddhav Thackeray and said that he won't be able to finish him ever. "You tried your best, along with Congress and the NCP. You could not finish me and won't be able to do it later," he said. "Whatever is written in the destiny will only happen," Fadnavis added.

314.title: Wife hits husband, his lover after catching them in Agra hotel; video surfaces
314.article_body: A woman hit her husband and his lover with a slipper after catching them in a hotel room in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. A video of the incident showed the man apologising to his wife while the woman's brother reportedly live-streamed the incident on social media. She can also be heard requesting that police be called to the room.

315.title: Received huge amount of hate mail after calling moonlighting 'cheating': Premji
315.article_body: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said he has received a huge amount of hate mail since calling moonlighting 'cheating', adding that he stands by what he said. "There's a lot of chatter about people moonlighting in the tech industry. This is cheating - plain and simple," Premji had tweeted in August. Wipro has fired 300 people for working for its competitors.

316.title: RSS head meets All India Imam Organization chief at Delhi mosque
316.article_body: RSS head Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday met Imam Umer Ahmed Ilyasi, the chief of All India Imam Organization in a mosque at Kasturba Gandhi Marg in Delhi. The closed-door meeting reportedly lasted over an hour. "RSS Sarsanghachalak meets people from all walks of life. It is part of the continuous general 'Samvad' process," RSS Prachar Pramukh Sunil Ambekar said.

317.title: 8 people injured after cab overturns in J&K's Rajouri
317.article_body: Eight people suffered injuries as the cab they were travelling in overturned after skidding off in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Thursday morning. The accident took place near Magi Mohre when the cab was coming from Bufliaz. Following the incident, passersby took the injured persons to a nearby hospital where their condition was said to be stable, ANI reported.

318.title: 6 drug peddlers held in Hyderabad; hash oil, 2 kg marijuana seized
318.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Wednesday arrested six interstate drug peddlers and seized 202 bottles of hash oil worth ₹4 lakh and two kg of marijuana worth ₹80,000 from them. The police also seized two bikes from the accused. The accused bought the contraband from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam, police said in a press release, adding that two other accused are currently absconding.

319.title: Dheeraj Dhoopar quits 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' due to health issues: Report
319.article_body: Television actor Dheeraj Dhoopar has reportedly quit 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' owing to his health issues. The actor had injured himself last week. "With the injury yet to heal, it did not seem feasible for him to continue. He discussed the same with the makers who amicably agreed to let him go," a source told The Indian Express.

320.title: 3 die, 6 injured as bus overturns trying to save bike in Chhattisgarh
320.article_body: At least three persons were killed and six others were injured on Wednesday after a bus overturned in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur. The bus was going from Pathalgaon to Ambikapur and it overturned while trying to save a bike coming from the wrong side, an official said. Among the deceased, two were riding on the bike and one was a bus passenger.

321.title: Rupee ends at new all-time low of 80.86 against US dollar
321.article_body: The rupee ended at a record low of 80.86 against the US dollar on Thursday, down from 79.97 in the previous session. This was the biggest single-day fall for the rupee since February 24. The dollar surged to a fresh two-decade high on Wednesday after the US Federal Reserve raised interest rates by another 75 basis points.

322.title: Taapsee Pannu gets mobbed by media photographers, video goes viral
322.article_body: A video shows actress Taapsee Pannu getting mobbed by media photographers after a movie screening. A person near Taapsee asked her about comedian Raju Srivastava's death while several people blocked her path. "Give me a minute. Please step aside, don't do this, move a little bit, step back," she said and then quickly walked away after saying 'thank you'.

323.title: Want to be known for craft, not just box office numbers: Ali Abbas Zafar
323.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar has said he doesn't want to be known just by the box office numbers of his films but also for his craft as a filmmaker. He said he admires filmmakers who have been diverse in their filmmaking choices. He added he's "highly inspired by the filmography" of late Yash Chopra, who "made all kinds of films".

324.title: We're planning to make 'Karthikeya 3', this time in 3D: Nikhil Siddhartha
324.article_body: Telugu actor Nikhil Siddhartha has confirmed the third instalment of the 'Karthikeya' franchise. "With everyone's blessings, we are planning to make 'Karthikeya 3'," he said, adding that this time it's "more exciting" as the makers are planning to make the film in 3D. Currently, Nikhil is busy promoting the Malayalam version of 'Karthikeya 2', which will release on September 23.

325.title: Teacher canes 13-yr-old student, uses casteist slurs in Pune; booked
325.article_body: The Rural Police have booked a school teacher from a village in Maharashtra's Pune district for allegedly caning a 13-year-old student and hurling casteist slurs against him. According to the complaint filed by the family members, the teacher caned the student on his back during ongoing school classes, said Inspector Narayan Pawar, in-charge of Yavat police station.

326.title: Kerala man sets 75-yr-old mother on fire for not giving money to buy liquor
326.article_body: A 55-year-old man in Kerala's Thrissur was arrested for reportedly setting his 75-year-old mother on fire after she refused to give him money to buy liquor. The woman has suffered severe burn injuries. According to the information received by the police, the man would frequently attack his mother when she refused to give him money for liquor.

327.title: Chunky was called revolving door, one girl entered as another left: Bhavana
327.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey, during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7', revealed her husband Chunky Panday was called a "revolving door". "[Revolving door] means, one girl used to leave from one door...another one would enter from the other. He was called that and that's what I heard when I got married to him," she added.

328.title: Assam man who raped 11-yr-old niece, gave her ₹100 & chips gets life sentence
328.article_body: A court in Assam has sentenced a 31-year-old man to life imprisonment for raping his 11-year-old niece. The convict had lured the minor to his house, raped her and given her ₹100 and a chips packet. The girl came home crying and told her mother about the incident. He had threatened to kill her family if they file a complaint.

329.title: We're fighting a machine that has captured India's institutional framework: Rahul
329.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said, "We're fighting a machine that has captured the institutional framework of India." He added, "They've unlimited money to pressurise and threaten people. The outcome of that is what we've witnessed in Goa." Speaking about the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', he said it is designed to tell the people that they need to be united.

330.title: BJP spent ₹340 cr on poll campaign in 5 states, max in UP: Report
330.article_body: BJP spent over ₹340 crore in the Assembly elections held in five states, including UP, Punjab, Goa, Manipur and Uttarakhand, earlier this year, according to an election expenditure report submitted to Election Commission. The report showed that BJP spent the maximum amount of ₹221.32 crore in Uttar Pradesh. Meanwhile, Congress spent over ₹194 crore for campaigning in these five states.

331.title: Drunk men assault 4 friends outside ahata in Gurugram
331.article_body: Six men reportedly assaulted four friends outside an ahata (drinking place) in Gurugram on Sunday. The youths were partying when a drunk man came to their table and started abusing them. They calmed him down and went towards parking to avoid tension, but he called his friends, who intercepted them and started hitting them with liquor bottles, the complainant said.

332.title: 22-year-old man in Mumbai for army interview run over by train; dies
332.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who had come to Thane for an interview under the 'Agnipath' scheme, reportedly died after being run over by a speeding train at Mumbra railway station. The deceased has been identified as Rameshwar Deore. He was rushed to Thane Civil Hospital, but doctors declared him brought dead, police said.

333.title: 2 LeT terrorists, planning to attack civilians, arrested in J&K's Sopore
333.article_body: Two Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorists were arrested following a joint cordon and search operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Sopore area on Wednesday. The apprehended persons, identified as Imtiaz Ahmad Ganai and Waseem Ahmad Lone, were allegedly planning to attack security forces & civilians. Police also seized one pistol, eight pistol rounds and one Chinese hand grenade from them.

334.title: China calls for dialogue after Russian President's warning to West
334.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said Beijing urged all parties engaged in Russia-Ukraine conflict to hold dialogue and consultation and find a way to address the security concerns. The statement comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin issued a warning to the West on using nuclear weapons. Putin announced mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of soldiers to fight in Ukraine.

335.title: G7 vows targeted sanctions against Russia in further support for Ukraine
335.article_body: Foreign Ministers of the Group of Seven (G7) nations, who met on the sidelines of the 77th session of the UN General Assembly, pledged to pursue targeted sanctions against Russia in further cooperation to support Ukraine. The leaders "deplored deliberate Russian escalatory steps". They also criticised Russia's plan to hold referenda on Ukrainian territory, calling it a sham.

336.title: Video shows police lathi-charging fans during ticket sale for India-Aus match in Hyderabad
336.article_body: Police resorted to lathi-charge to disperse the fans after chaos broke out during the ticket sale for India-Australia T20I match in Hyderabad. Several people were injured, including police officials, and they have been moved to hospital for treatment. The match is scheduled to take place at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium on September 25.

337.title: I've never seen anything like this: Angelina Jolie in flood-hit Pakistan
337.article_body: Actress Angelina Jolie, who is in Pakistan to provide help to people affected by floods, has said, "I've never seen anything like this...I am overwhelmed." She added, ''I think this is a real wake-up call to the world about where we are at and that climate change is not only real and it's not only coming, it's very much here."

338.title: Significant breach: Singapore Telecom's Australian unit on customer data leak
338.article_body: Optus, the Australian unit of Singapore Telecommunications, called the unauthorised access of its customer details "a significant breach by Australian standards". "While we're not aware of customers having suffered any harm, we encourage customers to have heightened awareness," Optus said. Optus CEO KB Rosmarin said in "a rare number of cases, passport and the mailing address" had been exposed.

339.title: Assam man rapes 11-year-old niece, gives her ₹100; gets life imprisonment
339.article_body: An Assam court awarded a 31-year-old man life imprisonment for raping his 11-year-old niece under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. The man enticed the minor to his house, raped her and sent her with a ₹100 note and a packet of chips, the victim's mother said. The accused allegedly threatened to kill her family members.

340.title: Russia-Finland border traffic rises after Putin's mobilisation move
340.article_body: The Finnish Border Guard on Thursday said that traffic arriving at Finland's eastern border with Russia "intensified" overnight. It comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday ordered a partial mobilisation for the war in Ukraine. A total of 4,824 Russians arrived in Finland on Wednesday, up from the 3,133 a week earlier, the Finnish Border Guard added.

341.title: Astronaut shares pics of how a rocket launch looks from space
341.article_body: Astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti, who's currently aboard the International Space Station (ISS), spotted the Russian Soyuz rocket's launch from space. Cristoforetti shared the pictures of how the rocket launch looked from space on social media and said it was a "spectacular view". A Russian Soyuz rocket carrying a NASA astronaut and two Russian cosmonauts launched from Kazakhstan on Wednesday.

342.title: What I'm today, can be accredited to 'Kasautii...' & Ektaa: Ronit Roy
342.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy has said that he started off his acting career with ₹1,500 a day and added that it took a while to earn a cheque of ₹1 lakh monthly. "It was not just the cheque, it's my entire life. What I am today, can be accredited to 'Kasautii Zindagii Kay', Ektaa Kapoor and Balaji Telefilms," he further added.

343.title: TN man kills grandmother for insisting his mother returns borrowed money
343.article_body: A man allegedly killed his 70-year-old grandmother after an argument and let her bleed to death while he continued to watch TV. The victim had been insisting her daughter, who is the accused's mother, to return the ₹1 lakh she had borrowed. In a fit of rage, the accused first slashed the victim and then attacked her with a hammer.

344.title: Man swallows 116 pellets of cocaine worth ₹15 cr, held in Mumbai
344.article_body: A 51-year-old Congo national was arrested after he swallowed 116 pellets stuffed with cocaine weighing 1.5 kilograms, worth approximately ₹15 crore, in a smuggling bid in Mumbai. After his arrest, the man passed 115 pellets through his stool, while the last pellet got stuck in his stomach's end. Doctors performed an endoscopy-guided laparoscopy surgery to pull out the last pellet.

345.title: YouTuber purposely crashes car to test iPhone 14 Pro's crash detection feature
345.article_body: 'TechRax' YouTube channel's owner Taras Maksimuk purposely crashed a car with an iPhone 14 Pro taped to a seat to test the phone's crash detection feature. After crashing the remote-controlled car into a pile of old vehicles, he said, "I can confirm the crash detection works." The crash detection feature connects the user with emergency services and notifies emergency contacts.

346.title: ₹859 cr tender finalised for 2nd corridor of B'luru suburban rail project
346.article_body: The Karnataka government has finalised a tender valued at ₹859 crore for construction of a 25-km second stretch of the proposed four-corridor suburban railway system in Bengaluru, state minister V Somanna said. Basic infrastructure for the second stretch will be completed in 27 months, he added. Karnataka government has spent ₹120 crore for suburban railway's preparatory work, he further said.

347.title: Near-total internet blackout in Iran amid protests against Mahsa Amini's death
