347.article_body: Iranians witnessed a near-total internet blackout on Wednesday amid protests against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was detained for allegedly violating Islamic dress code. According to internet watchdog NetBlocks, Iran curbed access to social media platforms like Instagram and WhatsApp. Security forces used tear gas and water cannons to disperse protesters, Amnesty International said.

348.title: Kamal Haasan starts shooting for 'Indian 2', shares pics
348.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan on Thursday shared that he has started shooting for 'Indian 2'. On Twitter, he shared a couple of pictures of himself with director Shankar. The news comes a day after Kajal Aggarwal announced that she has started preparing for 'Indian 2' four months after giving birth to her son Neil. It will also star Rakul Preet Singh.

349.title: Never looked at making 'Ponniyin Selvan' as web series: Mani Ratnam
349.article_body: Director Mani Ratnam said when he first read Kalki Krishnamurthy's five-part novel 'Ponniyin Selvan', he imagined it fit for the big screen adaptation. "It has always been a film for me," he said, adding that he never looked at the option of making his upcoming film 'Ponniyin Selvan' as a web series. The film will release on September 30.

350.title: Water cannons used on BJP workers heading towards Punjab CM's residence
350.article_body: Police used water cannons against BJP workers who were marching towards Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's residence in Chandigarh on Thursday. The workers, planning to gherao the residence, were holding a counter-protest against the state government. They were seen trying to scale barricades. Earlier, AAP MLAs protested against Punjab Governor Banwarilal Purohit's decision over a special Assembly session.

351.title: Heard that Nitish Kumar, Tejashwi are sad about Shah's Bihar visit: RS Prasad
351.article_body: Ahead of Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to Bihar, BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "I've heard that Lalu Ji (RJD chief), Nitish Ji (Bihar CM) and Deputy CM Tejashwi Ji are sad that...Amit Shah is coming to Bihar." Furthermore, he asked, "Does the Home Minister now need to take a directive from them to go to Bihar?"

352.title: At least 1 dead as Mexico hit by 2nd powerful earthquake in a week
352.article_body: At least one person has been killed after a 6.8-magnitude earthquake struck western Mexico on Thursday. The woman died after she fell down the stairs of her home in Mexico City as quake alarms rang out and buildings began to shake, officials said. This comes three days after a 7.6-magnitude earthquake shook western and central Mexico, killing two people.

353.title: Fight breaks out between students in Ghaziabad, continues even after 2 get hit by car
353.article_body: A fight broke out on Wednesday afternoon between students of a Ghaziabad college, and continued despite two of them being struck by a speeding car. The police said several students have been detained after the incident. "The car was being driven by a student who lost control and could not apply brakes on time," said an official.

354.title: 106 PFI members arrested in raids by NIA, ED across 11 states
354.article_body: As many as 106 PFI members were arrested in raids jointly carried out by the NIA, the ED and police across 11 states. Over 1,500 law enforcement personnel were reportedly involved in the operation. Offices and residences of those allegedly involved in "funding terrorism, organising training camps and radicalising people to join proscribed organisations" were raided, reported ANI.

355.title: People look for drama anywhere: Olivia on Harry-Chris' spitting reports
355.article_body: Olivia Wilde has clarified that Harry Styles didn't spit on Chris Pine during the Venice premiere of 'Don't Worry Darling'. Wilde called it a "perfect example" of how people "look for drama anywhere they can". Her reaction has come days after a video went viral, in which fans claimed that Styles had spit on Chris Pine.

356.title: Pune is the flag bearer of Indian culture: Nirmala Sitharaman
356.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Wednesday inaugurated 'Bharat Vidya', an online platform of courses started by the Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) in Pune. She said, "The contribution by...(BORI) for Pune and...rest of the country is significant." "Pune is the flag bearer of Indian culture and...by digitising the data of rare books and manuscripts is the next step," she added.

357.title: E-bike rental service approved in Pune, 5,000 vehicles to run on pilot basis
357.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has approved the implementation of electric bike rental service in the city on a pilot basis for one year. Around 5,000 e-bikes will be available during the pilot phase and citizens will be able to rent them at a rate of ₹4 per kilometre. The bikes would be available at 250 locations across the city.

358.title: Jaishankar compares India & China's economy, lists '3 big things that went wrong for us'
358.article_body: Comparing the economies of India and China in US, MEA S Jaishankar said, "There were three big things which went wrong for us; one was of course at the start, the Partition, the delay in exercising the nuclear option, and delay in economic reform." He added, "China grew in this period territorially. China exercised its nuclear option early in 1964."

359.title: 'The Kashmir Files' & 'Rocketry' should also be sent to Oscars: Madhavan
359.article_body: Actor-director R Madhavan said India should also consider sending 'Rocketry' and 'The Kashmir Files' to the Oscars. His reaction has come after Gujarati film 'Chhello Show' was announced as India's official entry to the upcoming 95th Academy Awards. "I'm starting a campaign for Rocketry," he said. On 'Chhello Show', Madhavan said he hopes the film wins and makes India proud.

360.title: You came using PM Modi's photo, backstabbed BJP: Fadnavis to Uddhav
360.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Thursday criticised former CM Uddhav Thackeray saying, "In 2019 polls, you [Thackeray] came [to power] by showing PM [Narendra] Modi's photo, backstabbed BJP and went with Congress and NCP." "[You] tried your best to finish me [but] could not…and won't be able to do it later," he added.

361.title: TCS mandates employees to work from office 3 times a week
361.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services has sent an email to its employees mandating them to work from the office three times a week. The email further stated that managers will create a roster, and adhering to the roster is mandatory. It also said, "Needless to mention, any non-compliance will be taken seriously, and administrative measures may be applied."

362.title: 26-yr-old woman dies by suicide over harassment by youth in UP
362.article_body: A 26-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after being harassed by a youth and his two friends in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar on Wednesday. According to the woman's family, the accused used to harass her for marriage and it continued even after she got married. The accused had reportedly threatened to kill the woman's husband and mother-in-law for rejecting his proposal.

363.title: Stampede at Hyd's Gymkhana for Ind-Aus cricket match tickets; 4 injured
363.article_body: A stampede broke out at Hyderabad's Gymkhana Ground after a huge crowd gathered to get tickets for the upcoming India versus Australia match scheduled for 25th September at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. Four people were injured in the incident. People reportedly queued outside the ticket counter since 5 am to buy tickets. Police lathi-charged to control the situation.

364.title: Hungarian PM says EU's sanctions on Russia should be scrapped: Report
364.article_body: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán told his ruling party that European Union's sanctions against Russia should be scrapped, a report said. According to a news platform, Orbán said EU sanctions have driven up gas prices and inflation, and if these measures were to be scrapped, gas prices would drop by 50%. "Sanctions are hurting Europe more than Russia," Orbán reiterated.

365.title: Rahul Gandhi resumes 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', plants sapling at Aluva college
365.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday resumed 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Kerala's Aluva by planting a sapling brought from Lakshadweep at the premises of the Union Christian College, Aluva. "Rahul Gandhi paid tribute at a mango tree planted by Bapu there in the year 1925," Congress tweeted. On the 15th day of the 'yatra', many people joined Gandhi.

366.title: Congress President election schedule released, result on Oct 19
366.article_body: Congress released the schedule for election of its party President on Thursday. The nominations can be filed between September 24 and 30, while the list of final candidates will be published on October 8. The date of polling, if needed, will be October 17. Counting of votes and declaration of the result will be done on October 19.

367.title: Around 500 trees uprooted in Pune in last 3 months claiming lives
367.article_body: Pune witnessed around 500 tree-fall incidents in past three months which led to many deaths and serious injuries, Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) environment department said. Unplanned pruning of trees and putting concrete around trunks are key reasons for increase in tree-fall incidents, an official said. While inspecting, the officials found that many old trees don't have strong bases.

368.title: Supreme Court reserves judgement in Karnataka hijab ban case
368.article_body: Supreme Court reserved its judgement after hearing petitions challenging Karnataka High Court's order upholding hijab ban in educational institutes. "For those who are believers, it's essential. For those who are not...it's not essential," the advocate representing Muslim appellants said. Hijab is only restricted in classrooms, Karnataka Advocate General Prabhuling Navadgi told SC on Wednesday.

369.title: Fee hike by 400 times 'falsehood': Allahabad University amid protests
369.article_body: Allahabad University Vice-Chancellor Sangita Srivastava said that the claim of a hike in fees by 400 times was a "falsehood". This comes amid ongoing protests by students against fee hike. "The fee per student annually for the past several decades was ₹975 which comes to ₹81 per month...fee has been enhanced to ₹4,151 per year- ₹333 per month," Srivastava added.

370.title: Ford India finalises severance package for Chennai plant workers
370.article_body: Ford India, a subsidiary of US-based carmaker Ford, arrived at a final severance package for the workers of its Chennai plant after it decided to shut the plant down as part of a restructuring exercise. A cumulative severance package for each employee would range from ₹34.50 lakh-₹86.50 lakh and revised settlement would be an average of about 5.1 years' salary.

371.title: Ukraine calls for Russia to be stripped of veto rights at UNSC
371.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged the UN to impose "just punishment" on Russia and strip it of its UN Security Council (UNSC) veto power. Russia is a permanent UNSC member along with US, France, Britain and China. The UNSC meeting comes a day after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of troops to fight in Ukraine.

372.title: Ashneer shares pic with Kohli, says 'Delhi boys with common passion for 'Ben Stokes''
372.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover on Wednesday shared a picture with Virat Kohli and wrote, "What could the Delhi boys with a common passion for 'Ben Stokes' be discussing?" "All the best Virat Kohli for the match in Nagpur," he tweeted. The second T20I between India and Australia will be played in Nagpur tomorrow.

373.title: UP Assembly reserves today for women MLAs to raise their issues
373.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Assembly has reserved Thursday, September 22, for women MLAs to raise their issues, a step that Speaker Satish Mahana said no other legislative Assembly in the country has taken so far. There are 47 women MLAs in the 403-member UP Legislative Assembly and out of which 22 are first-timers.

374.title: Efforts on to change country's history: West Bengal CM Mamata
374.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday inaugurated the Alipore Independence Museum and said that the state has played an important role in country's struggle for independence. However, without naming anyone, Banerjee alleged that the country's history is being "changed" so that the future generation remains unaware. She added that it's the TMC government which is trying to "save" history.

375.title: SpiceJet pilots to get 20% pay hike, days after 80 of them sent on unpaid leave
375.article_body: SpiceJet will give a 20% salary hike to its pilots in October this year. This comes days after the airline sent 80 pilots on 3-month unpaid leave as a temporary measure to rationalise costs. As a part of the Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme, SpiceJet has reportedly received the first tranche of payment and the second tranche is expected soon.

376.title: Class 1 girl gets locked up in school for 18 hours in UP's Sambhal
376.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was left locked behind in a school for about 18 hours in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal district. The girl's relatives went looking for her but the school staff told her grandmother that no children were left there. The girl, a Class 1 student, was found only after the school reopened the next morning on Wednesday.

377.title: PFI workers protest in Kerala, K'taka, Tamil Nadu after NIA raids
377.article_body: The workers of Popular Front of India (PFI) took to the streets in Kerala, Karnataka and Tamil Nadu after the NIA raided its offices and leaders' residences across the country on Thursday. The agency raided multiple locations in about 10 states and arrested over 100 PFI members. The workers raised slogans against the central government and its investigating agencies.

378.title: Land worth ₹70 cr cleared in Greater Noida in anti-encroachment drive
378.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) on Wednesday cleared about 35,000 square meters of land worth ₹70 crore in an anti-encroachment drive in Sunpura. "Five JCBs were operated for about one-and-a-half hours," an official said. "An elimination squad has been formed to stop illegal occupation...GNIDA has deployed retired Army personnel...at its own expense," GNIDA CEO said.

379.title: Delhi government cuts school exam budget to ₹90 per student
379.article_body: The Delhi government has cut down the budget for conducting exams at government schools from ₹125 to ₹90 per student from Class 1 to Class 11 for 2022-23, the Directorate of Education (DoE) said in a circular. The DoE cited "shortage of budget" as reason behind the price deduction. "Demand of additional budget will not be entertained," the circular added.

380.title: Over 1,300 arrested at anti-mobilisation protests in Russia
380.article_body: Protests were held in several cities in Russia on Wednesday against President Vladimir Putin's announcement of a partial mobilisation of reservists to fight in Ukraine. Over 1,300 people were arrested at anti-mobilisation rallies in 38 cities, including Moscow, Russian protest monitoring group OVD-Info said. Meanwhile, most flights out of Russia were sold out after Putin's announcement.

381.title: Russians google 'How to leave Russia', 'How to break arm at home' amid mobilisation call
381.article_body: Google search trends in Russia showed a spike in queries like "how to leave Russia" and "how to break an arm at home" ahead of President Vladimir Putin's address on Wednesday in which he was likely to announce "martial law" and "mobilisation". Putin ordered country's first mobilisation since World War II, warning that he is not bluffing about nuclear attack.

382.title: Pune civic body to use automated vehicles to catch stray animals
382.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to use automated vehicles with hydraulic systems to catch stray animals in the city. According to a civic official, a tender for such vehicles will be issued soon. "A minimum of one vehicle will be given to each ward and its number may increase as per the requirement," said PMC official Jalinder Kharmade.

383.title: N Korea may soon launch new missile submarine: US-based think tank
383.article_body: North Korea might be preparing to launch a new submarine believed to be capable of firing ballistic missiles, a US-based think tank 38 North said, citing commercial satellite imagery. The images by the Sinpho South Shipyard from September 18 show never-seen-before vessels gathered around the construction hall quay. In May this year, North Korea test-fired a submarine-launched ballistic missile.

384.title: US President Joe Biden appears lost on stage after his speech; video surfaces
384.article_body: A video of US President Joe Biden appearing lost on stage after his speech at an event has surfaced on social media. The US President was addressing the Global Fund's Seventh Replenishment Conference in New York on Wednesday. After his address, he turned to leave the podium but stopped and looked lost.

385.title: SBI stock falls marginally after it raises ₹4,000 crore via bonds
385.article_body: A day after the State Bank of India raised ₹4,000 crore Basel III compliant Tier 2 bonds, its shares traded lower on Thursday. At 11:50 am, it was trading at ₹566.05 apiece, down 0.64% on NSE. SBI's issue was oversubscribed by about five times against the base issue size of ₹2,000 crore with bids of ₹9,647 crore.

386.title: Comedian Raju Srivastava cremated in Delhi
386.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava was cremated at Nigambodh Ghat crematorium in Delhi on Thursday. He passed away on Wednesday at the age of 58. Srivastava was admitted to the All India Institute Of Medical Sciences in Delhi last month after suffering a heart attack and collapsing while working out at a gym.

387.title: Why do you need 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', India is strongly united: Amarinder Singh
387.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh questioned the need for Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "In the first instance, why do you need a 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'? India is strongly united already and is going from strength to strength," Singh added. "Yes, you may need to unite Congress and you should've named it appropriately. Maybe, it would've helped," he stated.

388.title: My father ran out of money in 90s, me & my brother supported him: Musk
388.article_body: The world’s richest person Elon Musk on Twitter revealed that his father, Errol, ran out of money in the 90s and that it was he and his brother who financially supported him. Musk was responding to a thread wherein a US professor claimed that Musk's family owned emerald mines in Apartheid-era South Africa, to which Musk called him a "liar".

389.title: HRERA restricts sale, purchase of properties in Gurugram's Vatika project
389.article_body: The Haryana Real Estate Regulatory Authority (HRERA) has restricted sale and purchase of properties in Vatika Limited's residential projects in Gurugram's sector 88A and 88B, the authority said in a statement. Stating the reason behind the restriction, HRERA said that licence of the project expired in 2019 and the developer is yet to submit documents required for completing mandatory registration.

390.title: SpiceJet shares fall most in 3 weeks after DGCA extends ops cap
390.article_body: A day after the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) extended restrictions on SpiceJet to operate at 50% capacity till October 29, its stock was trading 4% down on NSE on Thursday, the most in three weeks. At 11:27 am, it was trading at ₹40.15, down 4.06%. DGCA noted that the restrictions were extended "as a matter of abundant caution".

391.title: Tamil Nadu DMK MLA threatens auto firm's CEO, booked; video surfaces
391.article_body: Tamil Nadu DMK MLA SR Raja has been booked for threatening the CEO of an auto firm in Chengalpattu, police said. The incident was caught on camera wherein the MLA can be seen threatening and verbally abusing the firm's employees in Maraimalai Nagar. Raja was booked on Wednesday for using obscene language, trespassing and criminal intimidation, police added.

392.title: Ex-Honduras First Lady gets 14 years in prison on fraud charges
392.article_body: A court in Honduras has sentenced the country's former First Lady Rosa Bonilla to 14 years and one month in prison on charges of fraud and misappropriation of public funds destined for social programs. Bonilla spent around $590,000 meant for low-income children on personal credit card payments, her children's school fees and real estate construction, according to the public ministry.

393.title: Locals get authorities to construct road overnight at gunpoint in Gurugram, 30 booked
393.article_body: Police have booked 30 locals in Gurugram for allegedly threatening officials of Metropolitan Development Authority at gunpoint and forcing workers to construct a patch of road overnight. Police said Hoshiar Singh initiated the quarrel because he wanted a road constructed in front of his petrol pump. Singh said all villagers wanted the road because over 20 mishaps occurred there recently.

394.title: Reliance Retail is in talks to acquire Sephora India rights: Report
394.article_body: Reliance Retail is reportedly in advanced talks to get the rights for beauty retailer Sephora in India. According to a report, if the agreement is reached, Sephora's operations will transfer from Arvind Fashions to Reliance Retail. Sephora, owned by French luxury goods group LVMH, has 25 stores in India with brands in categories such as cosmetics and fragrances, among others.

395.title: Govt has taken revolutionary step in education field by bringing NEP: Thakur
395.article_body: The central government has taken a revolutionary step in the fields of sports, education, skill development and regional language education by bringing New Education Policy, Union Minister Anurag Thakur said. Furthermore, he said, today's era is about women empowerment, the biggest proof of which is that women are advancing in every field, especially education and sports.

396.title: Swiggy delivery agents in Chennai protest against revised payment rules
396.article_body: After Swiggy changed its pay structure this week, delivery agents have been protesting in various locations in Chennai, leading to a disruption in services. The agents alleged that according to the new rules, they would have to finish 180 orders a week to earn ₹11,500. Swiggy said that the new structure is created to provide more flexibility to delivery workers.

397.title: IMD predicts moderate to heavy rainfall in Delhi today, yellow alert issued
397.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted moderate rainfall and thundershowers, with heavy rainfall in one or two places in Delhi for Thursday. The weather agency has also issued a 'yellow' alert in the city for the day. While the maximum temperature is likely to be around 31°C, the minimum temperature registered earlier in the day was 23.8°C.

398.title: PM Modi has a powerful, influential voice on the world stage: UK
398.article_body: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war, UK Foreign Secretary James Cleverly said, "PM Modi has a powerful, influential voice on the world stage." "We know the Russian leadership respects India's voice and position on the world stage. I think PM Modi's intervention is very, very welcome," he added.

399.title: Mumbai Metro sells naming rights of 5 stations for ₹216 crore
399.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation sold naming rights of five stations on the Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ Metro 3 corridor for ₹216 crore. The five stations are Bandra Kurla Complex, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Siddhivinayak Metro Station, Churchgate and Hutatma Chowk. The buyers, including LIC, ICICI Lombard and Kotak Mahindra Bank, will be able to use their names in the stations as prefixes.

400.title: Monthly rent in Bengaluru's JP Nagar rose 13% since 2020: Report
400.article_body: Monthly rentals in Bengaluru's JP Nagar rose by 13 percent to ₹52,000 in 2022 from ₹46,000 in 2020, data from real estate consultant Anarock showed. The data further stated that among seven major cities in India, Bengaluru saw highest capital appreciation of nine percent, which meant average prices per square feet increased to ₹6,200 in 2022 from ₹5,698 in 2020.

401.title: Clarify that Jagan Mohan Reddy is not permanent president: EC to YSRCP
401.article_body: Election Commission (EC) on Wednesday directed YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) to clarify that Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is not its permanent president. EC added that it "categorically rejects any attempt or even a hint of any organisational post being of permanent nature". This comes amid reports claiming that Reddy has been appointed the party's permanent president.

402.title: 21-yr-old college student shares messages sent by Maroon 5 singer Adam Levine
402.article_body: A 21-year-old college student named Ashley Russell has shared messages that Maroon 5 singer Adam Levine sent her. Russell said that, earlier this year, the Maroon 5 singer would watch her Instagram stories, like her posts and message her directly. "He would like mainly like booty stories," she further said.
